1397        double[][] unpacked = new double[width][height];
1398        short x= 0, y = 0;
1399        for(int l = packed.length - limit; l < packed.length; l++) {
1400            boolean on = false;
1401            int idx = 0;
1402            for (int p = 0; p < packed[l].length; p++, on = !on) {
1403                if (on) {
1404                    for (int toSkip = idx + (packed[l][p] & 0xffff); idx < toSkip && idx < 0x10000; idx++) {
1405                        x = hilbertX[idx];
1406                        y = hilbertY[idx];
1407                        if(x >= width || y >= height)
1408                            continue;
1409                        unpacked[x][y] = levels[l];
1410                    }
1411                } else {
1412                    idx += packed[l][p] & 0xffff;
1413                }
1414            }
1415        }
1416        return unpacked;
1417    }
1418
1419    /**
1420     * Decompresses a short[][] returned by packMulti() and produces an approximation of the double[][] it compressed
1421     * using the given levels double[] as the values to assign, but only using the innermost indices up to limit, as
1422     * described in the {@link CoordPacker} class documentation. The length of levels and the length of the outer array
1423     * of packed do not have to be equal. However, the levels array passed to this method should not be identical to the
1424     * levels array passed to packMulti(); for FOV compression, you should get an array for levels using
1425     * generatePackingLevels(), but for decompression, you should create levels using generateLightLevels(), which
1426     * should more appropriately fit the desired output. Reusing the levels array used to pack the FOV will usually
1427     * produce values at the edge of FOV that are less than 0.01 but greater than 0, and will have a maximum value
1428     * somewhat less than 1.0; neither are usually desirable, but using a different array made with
1429     * generateLightLevels() will produce doubles ranging from 1.0 / levels.length to 1.0 at the highest. This method
1430     * takes an angle and span as well as a centerX and centerY; the only values that will be greater than 0.0 in the
1431     * result will be within the round-based conical section that could be produced by traveling from (centerX,centerY)
1432     * along angle in a limitless line and expanding the cone to be span degrees broad (circularly), centered on angle.
1433     * Width and height do not technically need to match the dimensions of the original 2D array, but under most
1434     * circumstances where they don't match, the data produced will be junk.
1435     * @param packed a short[][] encoded by calling this class' packMulti() method on a 2D array.
1436     * @param width the width of the 2D array that will be returned; should match the unpacked array's width.
1437     * @param height the height of the 2D array that will be returned; should match the unpacked array's height.
1438     * @param levels a double[] that must have the same length as packed, and will be used to assign cells in the
1439     *               returned double[][] based on what levels parameter was used to compress packed
1440     * @param limit the number of elements to consider from levels and packed, starting from the innermost.
1441     * @param centerX the x position of the corner or origin of the conical FOV
1442     * @param centerY the y position of the corner or origin of the conical FOV
1443     * @param angle the center of the conical area to limit this to, in degrees
1444     * @param span the total span of the conical area to limit this to, in degrees
1445     * @return a double[][] where the values that corresponded to the nth value in the levels parameter used to
1446     * compress packed will now correspond to the nth value in the levels parameter passed to this method.
1447     */
1448    public static double[][] unpackMultiDoublePartialConical(short[][] packed, int width, int height, double[] levels,
1449                                                      int limit, int centerX, int centerY, double angle, double span)
1450    {
1451        if(packed == null || packed.length == 0)
1452            throw new ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException(
1453                    "CoordPacker.unpackMultiDouble() must be given a non-empty array");
1454        if (levels == null || levels.length != packed.length)
1455            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("The lengths of packed and levels must be equal");
1456        if (levels.length > 63)
1457            throw new UnsupportedOperationException(
1458                    "Too many levels to be packed by CoordPacker; should be less than 64 but was given " +
1459                            levels.length);
1460        if(limit > levels.length)
1461            limit = levels.length;
1462
1463        double angle2 = Math.toRadians((angle > 360.0 || angle < 0.0) ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle);
1464        double span2 = Math.toRadians(span);
1465        double[][] unpacked = new double[width][height];
1466        short x= 0, y = 0;
1467        for(int l = packed.length - limit; l < packed.length; l++) {
1468            boolean on = false;
1469            int idx = 0;
1470            for (int p = 0; p < packed[l].length; p++, on = !on) {
1471                if (on) {
1472                    for (int toSkip = idx + (packed[l][p] & 0xffff); idx < toSkip && idx < 0x10000; idx++) {
1473                        x = hilbertX[idx];
1474                        y = hilbertY[idx];
1475                        if(x >= width || y >= height)
1476                            continue;
1477                        double newAngle = NumberTools.atan2(y - centerY, x - centerX) + Math.PI * 2;
1478                        if(Math.abs(MathExtras.remainder(angle2 - newAngle, Math.PI * 2) - Math.PI) > span2 * 0.5)
1479                            unpacked[x][y] = 0.0;
1480                        else
1481                            unpacked[x][y] = levels[l];
1482                    }
1483                } else {
1484                    idx += packed[l][p] & 0xffff;
1485                }
1486            }
1487        }
1488        return unpacked;
1489    }
1490
1491    /**
1492     * Decompresses a short[][] returned by packMulti() and produces a simple 2D array where the values are bytes
1493     * corresponding to 1 + the highest index into levels (that is, the original levels parameter passed to packMulti)
1494     * matched by a cell, or 0 if the cell didn't match any levels during compression, as described in the
1495     * {@link CoordPacker} class documentation. Width and height do not technically need to match the dimensions of
1496     * the original 2D array, but under most circumstances where they don't match, the data produced will be junk.
1497     * @param packed a short[][] encoded by calling this class' packMulti() method on a 2D array.
1498     * @param width the width of the 2D array that will be returned; should match the unpacked array's width.
1499     * @param height the height of the 2D array that will be returned; should match the unpacked array's height.
1500     * @return a byte[][] where the values that corresponded to the nth value in the levels parameter used to
1501     * compress packed will now correspond to bytes with the value n+1, or 0 if they were "off" in the original array.
1502     */
1503    public static byte[][] unpackMultiByte(short[][] packed, int width, int height)
1504    {
1505        if(packed == null || packed.length == 0)
1506            throw new ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException(
1507                    "CoordPacker.unpackMultiByte() must be given a non-empty array");
1508        byte[][] unpacked = new byte[width][height];
1509        byte lPlus = 1;
1510        short x=0, y=0;
1511        for(int l = 0; l < packed.length; l++, lPlus++) {
1512            boolean on = false;
1513            int idx = 0;
1514            for (int p = 0; p < packed[l].length; p++, on = !on) {
1515                if (on) {
1516                    for (int toSkip = idx + (packed[l][p] & 0xffff); idx < toSkip && idx <= 0xffff; idx++) {
1517                        x = hilbertX[idx];
1518                        y = hilbertY[idx];
1519                        if(x >= width || y >= height)
1520                            continue;
1521                        unpacked[x][y] = lPlus;
1522                    }
1523                } else {
1524                    idx += packed[l][p] & 0xffff;
1525                }
1526            }
1527        }
1528        return unpacked;
1529    }
1530
1531    /**
1532     * Given a piece of packed data defining a region to use from that map, a char to use for "on" cells and a char to use
1533     * for "off" cells, produces a 2D char array where all positions that are "off" in packed are filled with the char
1534     * passed as f, and the cells that are "on" are filled with the char passed as t. Finds the bounding rectangle starting
1535     * at the origin and extending to the highest x and highest y values encoded in packed, and uses that to determine the
1536     * width and height of the returned 2D array.
1537     * @param packed a packed short array, as produced by pack()
1538     * @param t the char to use for "on" positions in packed
1539     * @param f the char to use for "off" positions in packed
1540     * @return a 2D char array, with dimensions determined by the bounds of packed, where any "on" cells equal t and anything else equals f.
1541     */
1542    public static char[][] unpackChar(short[] packed, char t, char f)
1543    {
1544        if(packed == null || packed.length <= 1)
1545            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("packed has no contents in unpackChar");
1546
1547        Coord max = bounds(packed)[1];
1548        int width = max.x+1, height = max.y+1;
1549        if(width <= 0 || height <= 0)
1550            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Height and width must both be positive in unpackChar");
1551
1552        char[][] c = new char[width][height];
1553
1554        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
1555            Arrays.fill(c[i], f);
1556        }
1557        boolean on = false;
1558        int idx = 0, x, y;
1559        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
1560            if (on) {
1561                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
1562                    x = hilbertX[i];
1563                    y = hilbertY[i];
1564                    if(x >= width || y >= height)
1565                        continue;
1566                    c[x][y] = t;
1567                }
1568            }
1569            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
1570        }
1571        return c;
1572    }
1573    /**
1574     * Given a piece of packed data defining a region to use from that map, a desired width and height, a char to use for
1575     * "on" cells and a char to use for "off" cells, produces a 2D char array where all positions that are "off" in packed
1576     * are filled with the char passed as f, and the cells that are "on" are filled with the char passed as t.
1577     * @param packed a packed short array, as produced by pack()
1578     * @param width the desired 2D array width
1579     * @param height the desired 2D array height
1580     * @param t the char to use for "on" positions in packed
1581     * @param f the char to use for "off" positions in packed
1582     * @return a 2D char array, width by height in dimensions, where any "on" cells equal t and anything else equals f.
1583     */
1584    public static char[][] unpackChar(short[] packed, int width, int height, char t, char f)
1585    {
1586        if(width <= 0 || height <= 0)
1587            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Height and width must both be positive in unpackChar");
1588
1589        char[][] c = new char[width][height];
1590
1591        if(packed.length <= 1)
1592            return c;
1593        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
1594            Arrays.fill(c[i], f);
1595        }
1596        boolean on = false;
1597        int idx = 0, x, y;
1598        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
1599            if (on) {
1600                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
1601                    x = hilbertX[i];
1602                    y = hilbertY[i];
1603                    if(x >= width || y >= height)
1604                        continue;
1605                    c[x][y] = t;
1606                }
1607            }
1608            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
1609        }
1610        return c;
1611    }
1612
1613    /**
1614     * Utility method that constructs a GreasedRegion (a faster but more-memory-hungry way to encode regions)
1615     * from a short array of packed data.
1616     * @param packed a packed short array, as produced by pack()
1617     * @param width the desired GreasedRegion's width
1618     * @param height the desired GreasedRegion's height
1619     * @return a GreasedRegion that contains the same data as packed, with the specified width and height
1620     */
1621    public static GreasedRegion unpackGreasedRegion(short[] packed, int width, int height)
1622    {
1623        if(packed == null)
1624            throw new NullPointerException("CoordPacker.unpackGreasedRegion() must be given a non-null array");
1625        GreasedRegion unpacked = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
1626        if(packed.length == 0)
1627            return unpacked;
1628        boolean on = false;
1629        int idx = 0;
1630        short x, y;
1631        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
1632            if (on) {
1633                for (int toSkip = idx +(packed[p] & 0xffff); idx < toSkip && idx < 0x10000; idx++) {
1634                    x = hilbertX[idx];
1635                    y = hilbertY[idx];
1636                    unpacked.insert(x, y);
1637                }
1638            } else {
1639                idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
1640            }
1641        }
1642        return unpacked;
1643    }
1644
1645    /**
1646     * Utility method that fills an existing GreasedRegion {@code target} with any "on" cells in the packed short array
1647     * {@code packed}. This method doesn't allocate unless an argument is null (then it throws a new Exception).
1648     * @param packed a packed short array, as produced by pack()
1649     * @param target a GreasedRegion that will be modified in-place to include "on" cells from packed
1650     * @return target, after modifications to include any and all "on" cells in packed
1651     */
1652    public static GreasedRegion unpackIntoGreasedRegion(short[] packed, GreasedRegion target)
1653    {
1654        if(packed == null)
1655            throw new NullPointerException("CoordPacker.unpackIntoGreasedRegion() must be given a non-null array");
1656        if(target == null)
1657            throw new NullPointerException("CoordPacker.unpackIntoGreasedRegion() must be given a non-null GreasedRegion");
1658        if(packed.length == 0)
1659            return target;
1660        boolean on = false;
1661        int idx = 0;
1662        short x, y;
1663        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
1664            if (on) {
1665                for (int toSkip = idx +(packed[p] & 0xffff); idx < toSkip && idx < 0x10000; idx++) {
1666                    x = hilbertX[idx];
1667                    y = hilbertY[idx];
1668                    target.insert(x, y);
1669                }
1670            } else {
1671                idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
1672            }
1673        }
1674        return target;
1675    }
1676
1677    /**
1678     * Quickly determines if an x,y position is true or false in the given packed array, without unpacking it.
1679     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
1680     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
1681     * @param x between 0 and 255, inclusive
1682     * @param y between 0 and 255, inclusive
1683     * @return true if the packed data stores true at the given x,y location, or false in any other case.
1684     */
1685    public static boolean queryPacked(short[] packed, int x, int y)
1686    {
1687        int hilbertDistance = posToHilbert(x, y), total = 0;
1688        boolean on = false;
1689        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on)
1690        {
1691            total += packed[p] & 0xffff;
1692            if(hilbertDistance < total)
1693                return on;
1694        }
1695        return false;
1696    }
1697    /**
1698     * Quickly determines if a Hilbert Curve index corresponds to true or false in the given packed array, without
1699     * unpacking it.
1700     * <br>
1701     * Typically this method will not be needed by library-consuming code unless that code deals with Hilbert Curves in
1702     * a frequent and deeply involved manner. It does have the potential to avoid converting to and from x,y coordinates
1703     * and Hilbert Curve indices unnecessarily, which could matter for high-performance code.
1704     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
1705     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
1706     * @param hilbert a Hilbert Curve index, such as one taken directly from a packed short[] without extra processing
1707     * @return true if the packed data stores true at the given Hilbert Curve index, or false in any other case.
1708     */
1709    public static boolean queryPackedHilbert(short[] packed, short hilbert)
1710    {
1711        int hilbertDistance = hilbert & 0xffff, total = 0;
1712        boolean on = false;
1713        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on)
1714        {
1715            total += packed[p] & 0xffff;
1716            if(hilbertDistance < total)
1717                return on;
1718        }
1719        return false;
1720    }
1721
1722    /**
1723     * Quickly determines if an x,y position is true or false in one of the given packed arrays, without unpacking them,
1724     * and returns a List of all packed arrays that contain the position.
1725     * @param x between 0 and 255, inclusive
1726     * @param y between 0 and 255, inclusive
1727     * @param packed an array or vararg of short[], such as those returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is
1728     *               returned by packMulti(); null elements in packed will be skipped.
1729     * @return an OrderedSet of all packed arrays that store true at the given x,y location.
1730     */
1731    public static OrderedSet<short[]> findManyPacked(int x, int y, short[] ... packed)
1732    {
1733        OrderedSet<short[]> packs = new OrderedSet<>(packed.length, CrossHash.shortHasher);
1734        int hilbertDistance = posToHilbert(x, y);
1735        for (int a = 0; a < packed.length; a++) {
1736            if(packed[a] == null) continue;
1737            int total = 0;
1738            boolean on = false;
1739            for (int p = 0; p < packed[a].length; p++, on = !on) {
1740                total += packed[a][p] & 0xffff;
1741                if (hilbertDistance < total)
1742                {
1743                    if(on)
1744                        packs.add(packed[a]);
1745                    break;
1746                }
1747            }
1748        }
1749        return packs;
1750    }
1751    /**
1752     * Quickly determines if an x,y position is true or false in one of the given packed arrays, without unpacking them,
1753     * and returns a List of all packed arrays that contain the position.
1754     * @param x between 0 and 255, inclusive
1755     * @param y between 0 and 255, inclusive
1756     * @param packed a Collection of short[] (as encoded by this class); null elements in packed will be skipped.
1757     * @return an OrderedSet of all packed arrays that store true at the given x,y location.
1758     */
1759    public static OrderedSet<short[]> findManyPacked(int x, int y, Collection<short[]> packed)
1760    {
1761        OrderedSet<short[]> packs = new OrderedSet<>(packed.size(), CrossHash.shortHasher);
1762        int hilbertDistance = posToHilbert(x, y);
1763        for (short[] current : packed) {
1764            if(current == null) continue;
1765            int total = 0;
1766            boolean on = false;
1767            for (int p = 0; p < current.length; p++, on = !on) {
1768                total += current[p] & 0xffff;
1769                if (hilbertDistance < total)
1770                {
1771                    if(on)
1772                        packs.add(current);
1773                    break;
1774                }
1775            }
1776        }
1777        return packs;
1778    }
1779
1780    /**
1781     * Quickly determines if a region is contained in one of the given packed arrays, without unpacking them, and
1782     * returns true if the region checking has some overlap with any of the packed arrays, or false otherwise.
1783     * @param checking the packed data to check for overlap with the other regions
1784     * @param packed an array or vararg of short[], such as those returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is
1785     *               returned by packMulti(); null elements in packed will be skipped
1786     * @return true if checking overlaps with any of the packed arrays, or false otherwise
1787     */
1788    public static boolean regionsContain(short[] checking, short[] ... packed)
1789    {
1790        OrderedSet<short[]> packs = new OrderedSet<>(packed.length, CrossHash.shortHasher);
1791        for (int a = 0; a < packed.length; a++) {
1792            if(packed[a] == null) continue;
1793            if(intersects(checking, packed[a]))
1794                return true;
1795        }
1796        return false;
1797    }
1798    /**
1799     * Quickly determines if a region is contained in one of the given packed arrays, without unpacking them, and
1800     * returns true if the region checking has some overlap with any of the packed arrays, or false otherwise.
1801     * @param checking the packed data to check for overlap with the other regions
1802     * @param packed a Collection of short[], as encoded by this class; null elements in packed will be skipped
1803     * @return true if checking overlaps with any of the packed arrays, or false otherwise
1804     */
1805    public static boolean regionsContain(short[] checking, Collection<short[]> packed)
1806    {
1807        OrderedSet<short[]> packs = new OrderedSet<>(packed.size(), CrossHash.shortHasher);
1808        for (short[] current : packed) {
1809            if(current == null) continue;
1810            if(intersects(checking, current))
1811                return true;
1812        }
1813        return false;
1814    }
1815    /**
1816     * Quickly determines if a Hilbert Curve index corresponds to true or false in one of the given packed arrays,
1817     * without unpacking them, and returns a List of all packed arrays that contain the position.
1818     * <br>
1819     * Typically this method will not be needed by library-consuming code unless that code deals with Hilbert Curves in
1820     * a frequent and deeply involved manner. It does have the potential to avoid converting to and from x,y coordinates
1821     * and Hilbert Curve indices unnecessarily, which could matter for high-performance code.
1822     * @param hilbert a Hilbert Curve index, such as one taken directly from a packed short[] without extra processing
1823     * @param packed an array or vararg of short[], such as those returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is
1824     *               returned by packMulti(); null elements in packed will be skipped.
1825     * @return an ArrayList of all packed arrays that store true at the given x,y location.
1826     */
1827    public static ArrayList<short[]> findManyPackedHilbert(short hilbert, short[] ... packed)
1828    {
1829        ArrayList<short[]> packs = new ArrayList<>(packed.length);
1830        int hilbertDistance = hilbert & 0xffff;
1831        for (int a = 0; a < packed.length; a++) {
1832            int total = 0;
1833            boolean on = false;
1834            for (int p = 0; p < packed[a].length; p++, on = !on) {
1835                total += packed[a][p] & 0xffff;
1836                if (hilbertDistance < total)
1837                {
1838                    if(on)
1839                        packs.add(packed[a]);
1840                    break;
1841                }
1842            }
1843        }
1844        return packs;
1845    }
1846
1847    /**
1848     * Gets all positions that are "on" in the given packed array, without unpacking it, and returns them as a Coord[].
1849     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
1850     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
1851     * @return a Coord[], ordered by distance along the Hilbert Curve, corresponding to all "on" cells in packed.
1852     */
1853    public static Coord[] allPacked(short[] packed)
1854    {
1855        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(64);
1856        boolean on = false;
1857        int idx = 0;
1858        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
1859            if (on) {
1860                vla.addRange(idx, idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff));
1861            }
1862            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
1863        }
1864        int[] distances = vla.asInts();
1865        Coord[] cs = new Coord[distances.length];
1866        for (int i = 0; i < distances.length; i++) {
1867            cs[i] = Coord.get(hilbertX[distances[i]], hilbertY[distances[i]]);
1868        }
1869        return cs;
1870    }
1871
1872    /**
1873     * Gets all positions that are "on" in the given packed array, without unpacking it, and returns them as an array of
1874     * Hilbert Curve indices.
1875     * <br>
1876     * Typically this method will not be needed by library-consuming code unless that code deals with Hilbert Curves in
1877     * a frequent and deeply involved manner. It does have the potential to avoid converting to and from x,y coordinates
1878     * and Hilbert Curve indices unnecessarily, which could matter for high-performance code.
1879     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
1880     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
1881     * @return a Hilbert Curve index array, in ascending distance order, corresponding to all "on" cells in packed.
1882     */
1883    public static short[] allPackedHilbert(short[] packed)
1884    {
1885        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(64);
1886        boolean on = false;
1887        int idx = 0;
1888        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
1889            if (on) {
1890                vla.addRange(idx, idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff));
1891            }
1892            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
1893        }
1894        return vla.toArray();
1895    }
1896
1897    /**
1898     * Gets the nth position that is "on" in the given packed array, without unpacking it, and returns it as a Coord.
1899     * Uses Hilbert Curve ordering for the exact Hilbert Curve CoordPacker uses, so any two given Coords will always
1900     * have the same before-after relationship. Returns null if n is not between 0 (inclusive) and the count of packed
1901     * (exclusive), as by {@code CoordPacker.count()}.
1902     *
1903     * You can technically use nth to iterate over only the Coords that are defined in some packed data, but it's
1904     * drastically more efficient to store a Coord array once with allPacked(). Using nth() as an iterator is
1905     * essentially running a growing portion of what allPacked() does, over and over again, until the last Coord encoded
1906     * in packed takes almost as long to process as one call to allPacked(). That said, for a single Coord this can be
1907     * significantly faster than getting an array with allPacked() and fetching only one item from it.
1908     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
1909     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
1910     * @param n the index to get in packed
1911     * @return the nth Coord encoded as "on" by packed, ordered by distance along the Hilbert Curve, or null if n is out of bounds
1912     */
1913    public static Coord nth(final short[] packed, final int n)
1914    {
1915        if(n < 0)
1916            return null;
1917        boolean on = false;
1918        int idx = 0, ct = n, tmp;
1919        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
1920            tmp = (packed[p] & 0xffff);
1921            if (on) {
1922                if(ct - tmp < 0)
1923                {
1924                    idx += ct;
1925                    ct -= tmp;
1926                    break;
1927                }
1928                ct -= tmp;
1929            }
1930            idx += tmp;
1931        }
1932        if(ct >= 0)
1933            return null;
1934        return Coord.get(hilbertX[idx], hilbertY[idx]);
1935    }
1936    /**
1937     * Gets the positions that are "on" in the given packed array, without unpacking it, repeatedly goes through a
1938     * number of "on" cells equal to fraction and stores one of those cells as a Coord, and returns the accumulated
1939     * portion of positions as a Coord[].
1940     * <br>
1941     * For purposes of finding mostly cells with a similar distance to each other but without obvious patterns, a value
1942     * of 5, 6, or 7 for fraction works well for relatively-close Coords, but larger values are better for packed data
1943     * with wide, expansive areas. If you want to make the regular pattern this uses impossible to discern, you can use
1944     * {@code randomSeparated()} to keep distance between Coords and sample most areas of some packed data. Values for
1945     * fraction that are multiples of 4 are likely to show a pattern in large open spaces more easily.
1946     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
1947     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
1948     * @param fraction the denominator of the approximate fraction of "on" cells to use
1949     * @return a Coord[] corresponding to a fraction of the "on" cells in packed.
1950     */
1951    public static Coord[] fractionPacked(short[] packed, int fraction)
1952    {
1953        if(fraction <= 1)
1954            return allPacked(packed);
1955        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(64);
1956        boolean on = false;
1957        int idx = 0, ctr = 0;
1958        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
1959            if (on) {
1960                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++, ctr = (ctr + 1) % fraction) {
1961                    if(ctr == 0)
1962                        vla.add((short)i);
1963                }
1964            }
1965            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
1966        }
1967        int[] distances = vla.asInts();
1968        Coord[] cs = new Coord[distances.length];
1969        for (int i = 0; i < distances.length; i++) {
1970            cs[i] = Coord.get(hilbertX[distances[i]], hilbertY[distances[i]]);
1971        }
1972        return cs;
1973    }
1974
1975    /**
1976     * Gets the positions that are "on" in the given packed array, without unpacking it, repeatedly goes through a
1977     * number of "on" cells equal to fraction and stores a random one of those cells as a Coord, and returns the
1978     * accumulated random portion of positions as a Coord[]. Because of how this works, it is much more likely that the
1979     * Coords will be dispersed so that there's a good amount of minimum distance between most Coords, while methods
1980     * like randomPortion() do not make such dispersal a priority and may return tight clusters of Coords.
1981     * <br>
1982     * For purposes of finding mostly cells with a similar distance to each other but without obvious patterns, a value
1983     * of at least 7 for fraction works well.
1984     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
1985     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
1986     * @param separation the denominator of the approximate fraction of "on" cells to use
1987     * @param rng the {@link IRNG}, such as an {@link RNG} or {@link GWTRNG}, to use to randomize retrieval
1988     * @return a Coord[] corresponding to a fraction of the "on" cells in packed.
1989     */
1990    public static Coord[] randomSeparated(short[] packed, int separation, IRNG rng)
1991    {
1992        if(separation <= 1)
1993            return allPacked(packed);
1994        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(64);
1995        boolean on = false;
1996        int idx = 0, ctr = 0, tgt = rng.nextInt(separation);
1997        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
1998            if (on) {
1999                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++, ctr++) {
2000                    if(ctr >= separation)
2001                    {
2002                        ctr %= separation;
2003                        tgt = rng.nextInt(separation);
2004                    }
2005                    if(ctr == tgt)
2006                        vla.add((short)i);
2007                }
2008            }
2009            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2010        }
2011        int[] distances = vla.asInts();
2012        Coord[] cs = new Coord[distances.length];
2013        for (int i = 0; i < distances.length; i++) {
2014            cs[i] = Coord.get(hilbertX[distances[i]], hilbertY[distances[i]]);
2015        }
2016        return cs;
2017    }
2018
2019    /**
2020     * Gets the positions that are "on" in the given packed array, without unpacking it, repeatedly goes through a
2021     * number of "on" cells equal to fraction and stores one of those cells as a Coord, and returns the accumulated
2022     * portion of positions as an array of Hilbert Curve indices.
2023     * <br>
2024     * For purposes of finding mostly cells with a similar distance to each other but without obvious patterns, a value
2025     * of 5, 6, or 7 for fraction works well.
2026     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
2027     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
2028     * @param fraction the approximate fraction of "on" cells to use
2029     * @return a Hilbert Curve index array corresponding to a fraction of the "on" cells in packed.
2030     */
2031    public static short[] fractionPackedHilbert(short[] packed, int fraction)
2032    {
2033        if(fraction <= 1)
2034            return allPackedHilbert(packed);
2035        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(64);
2036        boolean on = false;
2037        int idx = 0, ctr = 0;
2038        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2039            if (on) {
2040                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++, ctr = (ctr + 1) % fraction) {
2041                    if(ctr == 0)
2042                        vla.add((short)i);
2043                }
2044            }
2045            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2046        }
2047        return vla.toArray();
2048    }
2049
2050    /**
2051     * Gets the positions that are "on" in the given packed array, without unpacking it, keeps only positions that are
2052     * at least minDistance apart from other positions this will return, and returns the positions as a Coord[].
2053     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
2054     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
2055     * @param minDistance the minimum distance (measured 8-way, Chebyshev) between any positions this returns
2056     * @return a Coord[] corresponding to a portion of the "on" cells in packed.
2057     */
2058    public static Coord[] apartPacked(short[] packed, int minDistance)
2059    {
2060        if(minDistance < 1)
2061            return allPacked(packed);
2062        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(64);
2063        boolean on = false;
2064        int idx = 0;
2065        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(256);
2066        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2067            if (on) {
2068                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2069                    int x = hilbertX[i], y = hilbertY[i], dist = hilbertDistances[x + (y << 8)];
2070                    if (ss.add((short) dist)) {
2071                        for (int xx = Math.max(0, x - minDistance); xx <= Math.min(255, x + minDistance); xx++) {
2072                            for (int yy = Math.max(0, y - minDistance); yy <= Math.min(255, y + minDistance); yy++) {
2073                                dist = hilbertDistances[xx + (yy << 8)];
2074                                if(dist >= i)
2075                                    ss.add((short) dist);
2076                            }
2077                        }
2078                        vla.add((short) i);
2079                    }
2080                }
2081            }
2082            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2083        }
2084        int[] distances = vla.asInts();
2085        Coord[] cs = new Coord[distances.length];
2086        for (int i = 0; i < distances.length; i++) {
2087            cs[i] = Coord.get(hilbertX[distances[i]], hilbertY[distances[i]]);
2088        }
2089        return cs;
2090    }
2091    /**
2092     * Gets the positions that are "on" in the given packed array, without unpacking it, keeps only positions that are
2093     * at least minDistance apart from other positions this will return, and returns the positions as a Coord[].
2094     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
2095     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
2096     * @param minDistance the minimum distance (measurement depends on eightWay) between any positions this returns
2097     * @param eightWay true if distance should be measured equally in 8 directions, false to use 4 directions
2098     * @return a Coord[] corresponding to a portion of the "on" cells in packed.
2099     */
2100    public static Coord[] apartPacked(short[] packed, int minDistance, boolean eightWay)
2101    {
2102        if(minDistance < 1)
2103            return allPacked(packed);
2104        if(eightWay)
2105            return apartPacked(packed, minDistance);
2106
2107        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(64);
2108        boolean on = false;
2109        int idx = 0;
2110        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(256);
2111        int xx, yy;
2112        int[] xOffsets = new int[]{0, 1, 0, -1, 0}, yOffsets = new int[]{1, 0, -1, 0, 1};
2113        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2114            if (on) {
2115                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2116                    int x = hilbertX[i], y = hilbertY[i], dist = hilbertDistances[x + (y << 8)];
2117                    if (ss.add((short) dist)) {
2118                        for (int d = 0; d < 4; d++) {
2119                            for (int e = 1; e <= minDistance; e++) {
2120                                for (int e2 = 0; e2 < minDistance; e2++) {
2121                                    xx = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, x + xOffsets[d] * e + yOffsets[d + 1] * e2));
2122                                    yy = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, y + yOffsets[d] * e + xOffsets[d + 1] * e2));
2123                                    dist = hilbertDistances[xx + (yy << 8)];
2124                                    if (dist >= i)
2125                                        ss.add((short) dist);
2126                                }
2127                            }
2128                        }
2129                        vla.add((short) i);
2130                    }
2131                }
2132            }
2133            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2134        }
2135        int[] distances = vla.asInts();
2136        Coord[] cs = new Coord[distances.length];
2137        for (int i = 0; i < distances.length; i++) {
2138            cs[i] = Coord.get(hilbertX[distances[i]], hilbertY[distances[i]]);
2139        }
2140        return cs;
2141    }

2143    /**
2144     * Gets the positions that are "on" in the given packed array, without unpacking it, keeps only positions that are
2145     * at least minDistance apart from other positions this will return, and returns the positions as an array of
2146     * Hilbert Curve indices.
2147     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
2148     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
2149     * @param minDistance the minimum distance (measured 8-way, Chebyshev) between any positions this returns
2150     * @return a Hilbert Curve index array corresponding to a portion of the "on" cells in packed.
2151     */
2152    public static short[] apartPackedHilbert(short[] packed, int minDistance)
2153    {
2154        if(minDistance < 1)
2155            return allPackedHilbert(packed);
2156        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(64);
2157        boolean on = false;
2158        int idx = 0;
2159        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(256);
2160        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2161            if (on) {
2162                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2163                    int x = hilbertX[i], y = hilbertY[i], dist = hilbertDistances[x + (y << 8)];
2164                    if (ss.add((short) dist)) {
2165                        for (int xx = Math.max(0, x - minDistance); xx <= Math.min(255, x + minDistance); xx++) {
2166                            for (int yy = Math.max(0, y - minDistance); yy <= Math.min(255, y + minDistance); yy++) {
2167                                dist = hilbertDistances[xx + (yy << 8)];
2168                                if(dist >= i)
2169                                    ss.add((short) dist);
2170                            }
2171                        }
2172                        vla.add((short) i);
2173                    }
2174                }
2175            }
2176            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2177        }
2178        return vla.toArray();
2179    }
2180
2181    /**
2182     * Gets the positions that are "on" in the given packed array, without unpacking it, keeps only positions that are
2183     * at least minDistance apart from other positions this will return, and returns the positions as an array of
2184     * Hilbert Curve indices.
2185     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti(); must
2186     *               not be null (this method does not check due to very tight performance constraints).
2187     * @param minDistance the minimum distance (measurement depends on eightWay) between any positions this returns
2188     * @param eightWay true if distance should be measured equally in 8 directions, false to use 4 directions
2189     * @return a Hilbert Curve index array corresponding to a portion of the "on" cells in packed.
2190     */
2191    public static short[] apartPackedHilbert(short[] packed, int minDistance, boolean eightWay)
2192    {
2193        if(minDistance < 1)
2194            return allPackedHilbert(packed);
2195        if(eightWay)
2196            return apartPackedHilbert(packed, minDistance);
2197
2198        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(64);
2199        boolean on = false;
2200        int idx = 0;
2201        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(256);
2202        int xx, yy;
2203        int[] xOffsets = new int[]{0, 1, 0, -1, 0}, yOffsets = new int[]{1, 0, -1, 0, 1};
2204        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2205            if (on) {
2206                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2207                    int x = hilbertX[i], y = hilbertY[i], dist = hilbertDistances[x + (y << 8)];
2208                    if (ss.add((short) dist)) {
2209                        for (int d = 0; d < 4; d++) {
2210                            for (int e = 1; e <= minDistance; e++) {
2211                                for (int e2 = 0; e2 < minDistance; e2++) {
2212                                    xx = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, x + xOffsets[d] * e + yOffsets[d + 1] * e2));
2213                                    yy = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, y + yOffsets[d] * e + xOffsets[d + 1] * e2));
2214                                    dist = hilbertDistances[xx + (yy << 8)];
2215                                    if (dist >= i)
2216                                        ss.add((short) dist);
2217                                }
2218                            }
2219                        }
2220                        vla.add((short) i);
2221                    }
2222                }
2223            }
2224            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2225        }
2226        return vla.toArray();
2227    }
2228    private static int clamp(int n, int min, int max)
2229    {
2230        return Math.min(Math.max(min, n), max - 1);
2231    }
2232
2233    /**
2234     * Move all "on" positions in packed by the number of cells given in xMove and yMove, unless the move
2235     * would take them further than 0, width - 1 (for xMove) or height - 1 (for yMove), in which case that
2236     * cell is stopped at the edge (moving any shape by an xMove greater than width or yMove greater than
2237     * height will move all "on" cells to that edge, in a 1-cell thick line). Returns a new packed short[]
2238     * and does not modify packed.
2239     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
2240     * @param xMove distance to move the x-coordinate; can be positive or negative
2241     * @param yMove distance to move the y-coordinate; can be positive or negative
2242     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
2243     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
2244     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that were moved from cells that were "on" in packed
2245     */
2246    public static short[] translate(short[] packed, int xMove, int yMove, int width, int height)
2247    {
2248        if(packed == null || packed.length <= 1)
2249        {
2250            return ALL_WALL;
2251        }
2252        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
2253        boolean on = false;
2254        int idx = 0, x, y;
2255        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2256            if (on) {
2257                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2258                    x = clamp(hilbertX[i] + xMove, 0, width);
2259                    y = clamp(hilbertY[i] + yMove, 0, height);
2260                    vla.add(hilbertDistances[x + (y << 8)]);
2261                }
2262            }
2263            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2264        }
2265        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
2266        if(indices.length < 1)
2267            return ALL_WALL;
2268        Arrays.sort(indices);
2269        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
2270        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
2271
2272        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
2273        for (int i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
2274            current = indices[i];
2275            if (current - past > 1)
2276            {
2277                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
2278                skip = 0;
2279                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
2280            }
2281            else if(current != past)
2282                skip++;
2283            past = current;
2284        }
2285        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
2286
2287        return vla.toArray();
2288    }
2289
2290    /**
2291     * Expand each "on" position in packed to cover a a square with side length equal to 1 + expansion * 2,
2292     * centered on the original "on" position, unless the expansion would take a cell further than 0,
2293     * width - 1 (for xMove) or height - 1 (for yMove), in which case that cell is stopped at the edge.
2294     * Uses 8-way movement (Chebyshev distance) unless the overload of this function that takes a boolean argument
2295     * eightWay is used and that argument is false.
2296     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify packed.
2297     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
2298     * @param expansion the positive (square) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by
2299     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
2300     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
2301     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for packed and cells that expanded from cells that were "on" in packed
2302     */
2303    public static short[] expand(short[] packed, int expansion, int width, int height)
2304    {
2305        if(packed == null || packed.length <= 1)
2306        {
2307            return ALL_WALL;
2308        }
2309        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
2310        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(256);
2311        boolean on = false;
2312        int idx = 0, x, y;
2313        short dist;
2314        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2315            if (on) {
2316                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2317                    x = hilbertX[i];
2318                    y = hilbertY[i];
2319                    for (int j = Math.max(0, x - expansion); j <= Math.min(width - 1, x + expansion); j++) {
2320                        for (int k = Math.max(0, y - expansion); k <= Math.min(height - 1, y + expansion); k++) {
2321                            dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
2322                            if (ss.add(dist))
2323                                vla.add(dist);
2324                        }
2325                    }
2326                }
2327            }
2328            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2329        }
2330
2331        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
2332        if(indices.length < 1)
2333            return ALL_WALL;
2334        Arrays.sort(indices);
2335
2336        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
2337        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
2338
2339        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
2340        for (int i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
2341            current = indices[i];
2342            if (current - past > 1)
2343            {
2344                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
2345                skip = 0;
2346                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
2347            }
2348            else if(current != past)
2349                skip++;
2350            past = current;
2351        }
2352        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
2353        return vla.toArray();
2354    }
2355
2356
2357    /**
2358     * Expand each "on" position in packed to cover a a square with side length equal to 1 + expansion * 2,
2359     * centered on the original "on" position, unless the expansion would take a cell further than 0,
2360     * width - 1 (for xMove) or height - 1 (for yMove), in which case that cell is stopped at the edge.
2361     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify packed.
2362     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
2363     * @param expansion the positive (square) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by
2364     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
2365     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
2366     * @param eightWay true if the expansion should be both diagonal and orthogonal; false for just orthogonal
2367     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for packed and cells that expanded from cells that were "on" in packed
2368     */
2369    public static short[] expand(short[] packed, int expansion, int width, int height, boolean eightWay)
2370    {
2371        if(eightWay)
2372            return expand(packed, expansion, width, height);
2373        if(packed == null || packed.length <= 1)
2374        {
2375            return ALL_WALL;
2376        }
2377        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
2378        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(256);
2379        boolean on = false;
2380        int idx = 0, x, y, j, k;
2381        short dist;
2382        int[] xOffsets = new int[]{0, 1, 0, -1, 0}, yOffsets = new int[]{1, 0, -1, 0, 1};
2383        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2384            if (on) {
2385                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2386                    x = hilbertX[i];
2387                    y = hilbertY[i];
2388                    dist = hilbertDistances[x + (y << 8)];
2389                    if (ss.add(dist))
2390                        vla.add(dist);
2391                    for (int d = 0; d < 4; d++) {
2392                        for (int e = 1; e <= expansion; e++) {
2393                            for (int e2 = 0; e2 <= expansion - e; e2++) {
2394                                j = Math.min(width - 1, Math.max(0, x + xOffsets[d] * e + yOffsets[d + 1] * e2));
2395                                k = Math.min(height - 1, Math.max(0, y + yOffsets[d] * e + xOffsets[d + 1] * e2));
2396                                dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
2397                                if (ss.add(dist))
2398                                    vla.add(dist);
2399                            }
2400                        }
2401                    }
2402                }
2403            }
2404            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2405        }
2406
2407        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
2408        if(indices.length < 1)
2409            return ALL_WALL;
2410        Arrays.sort(indices);
2411
2412        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
2413        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
2414
2415        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
2416        for (int i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
2417            current = indices[i];
2418            if (current - past > 1)
2419            {
2420                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
2421                skip = 0;
2422                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
2423            }
2424            else if(current != past)
2425                skip++;
2426            past = current;
2427        }
2428        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
2429
2430        return vla.toArray();
2431    }
2432
2433    /**
2434     * Finds the area made by removing the "on" positions in packed that are within the specified retraction distance of
2435     * an "off" position or the edge of the map. This essentially finds a shrunken version of packed.
2436     * Uses 8-way movement (Chebyshev distance) unless the overload of this function that takes a boolean argument
2437     * eightWay is used and that argument is false.
2438     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify packed.
2439     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
2440     * @param retraction the positive (square) radius, in cells, to pull each cell in by
2441     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
2442     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
2443     * @return a short[] that encodes "on" for cells that were "on" in packed and were far enough from an "off" cell
2444     */
2445    public static short[] retract(short[] packed, int retraction, int width, int height)
2446    {
2447        return differencePacked(packed, expand(negatePacked(packed), retraction, width, height, true));
2448    }

2504    /**
2505     * Finds the area made by removing the "on" positions in packed that are within the specified retraction distance of
2506     * an "off" position or the edge of the map. This essentially finds a shrunken version of packed.
2507     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify packed.
2508     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
2509     * @param retraction the positive (square) radius, in cells, to pull each cell in by
2510     * @param width the maximum width; cells outside this are considered "off" for this method's purposes
2511     * @param height the maximum height; cells outside this are considered "off" for this method's purposes
2512     * @param eightWay true if the retraction should be both diagonal and orthogonal; false for just orthogonal
2513     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for packed and cells that expanded from cells that were "on" in packed
2514     */
2515    public static short[] retract(short[] packed, int retraction, int width, int height, boolean eightWay)
2516    {
2517        return differencePacked(packed, expand(negatePacked(packed), retraction, width, height, eightWay));
2518    }
2519    /*
2520    {
2521        if(eightWay)
2522            return retract(packed, retraction, width, height);
2523        if(packed == null || packed.length <= 1)
2524        {
2525            return ALL_WALL;
2526        }

2535                {
2536                    x = hilbertX[i];
2537                    y = hilbertY[i];
2538                    for (int d = 0; d < 4; d++) {
2539                        for (int e = 1; e <= retraction; e++) {
2540                            for (int e2 = 0; e2 < retraction; e2++) {
2541                                j = x + xOffsets[d] * e + yOffsets[d + 1] * e2;
2542                                k = y + yOffsets[d] * e + xOffsets[d + 1] * e2;
2543                                if (j < 0 || k < 0 || j >= width || k >= height ||
2544                                        !queryPackedHilbert(packed, hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)]))
2545                                    continue INDICES;
2546                            }
2547                        }
2548                    }
2549                    vla.add((short)i);
2550                }
2551            }
2552            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2553        }

2569                skip = 0;

2583    /**
2584     * Finds the area around the cells encoded in packed, without including those cells. For each "on"
2585     * position in packed, expand it to cover a a square with side length equal to 1 + expansion * 2,
2586     * centered on the original "on" position, unless the expansion would take a cell further than 0,
2587     * width - 1 (for xMove) or height - 1 (for yMove), in which case that cell is stopped at the edge.
2588     * If a cell is "on" in packed, it will always be "off" in the result.
2589     * Uses 8-way movement (Chebyshev distance) unless the overload of this function that takes a boolean argument
2590     * eightWay is used and that argument is false.
2591     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify packed.
2592     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
2593     * @param expansion the positive (square-shaped) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by
2594     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
2595     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
2596     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that were pushed from the edge of packed's "on" cells
2597     */
2598    public static short[] fringe(short[] packed, int expansion, int width, int height)
2599    {
2600        if(packed == null || packed.length <= 1)
2601        {
2602            return ALL_WALL;
2603        }
2604        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
2605        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(256);
2606        boolean on = false;
2607        int idx = 0;
2608        short x, y, dist;
2609        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2610            if (on) {
2611                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2612                    ss.add((short) i);
2613                }
2614            }
2615            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2616        }
2617        on = false;
2618        idx = 0;
2619        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2620            if (on) {
2621                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2622                    x = hilbertX[i];
2623                    y = hilbertY[i];
2624                    for (int j = Math.max(0, x - expansion); j <= Math.min(width - 1, x + expansion); j++) {
2625                        for (int k = Math.max(0, y - expansion); k <= Math.min(height - 1, y + expansion); k++) {
2626                            dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
2627                            if (ss.add(dist))
2628                                vla.add(dist);
2629                        }
2630                    }
2631                }
2632            }
2633            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2634        }
2635        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
2636        if(indices.length < 1)
2637            return ALL_WALL;
2638        Arrays.sort(indices);
2639
2640        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
2641        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
2642
2643        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
2644        for (int i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
2645            current = indices[i];
2646            if (current - past > 1)
2647            {
2648                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
2649                skip = 0;
2650                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
2651            }
2652            else if(current != past)
2653                skip++;
2654            past = current;
2655        }
2656        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
2657
2658        return vla.toArray();
2659    }

2661    /**
2662     * Finds the area around the cells encoded in packed, without including those cells. For each "on"
2663     * position in packed, expand it to cover a a square with side length equal to 1 + expansion * 2,
2664     * centered on the original "on" position, unless the expansion would take a cell further than 0,
2665     * width - 1 (for xMove) or height - 1 (for yMove), in which case that cell is stopped at the edge.
2666     * If a cell is "on" in packed, it will always be "off" in the result.
2667     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify packed.
2668     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
2669     * @param expansion the positive (square-shaped) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by
2670     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
2671     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
2672     * @param eightWay true if the expansion should be both diagonal and orthogonal; false for just orthogonal
2673     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that were pushed from the edge of packed's "on" cells
2674     */
2675    public static short[] fringe(short[] packed, int expansion, int width, int height, boolean eightWay)
2676    {
2677        if(eightWay)
2678            return fringe(packed, expansion, width, height);
2679        if(packed == null || packed.length <= 1)
2680        {
2681            return ALL_WALL;
2682        }
2683        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
2684        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(256);
2685        boolean on = false;
2686        int idx = 0;
2687        short x, y, dist;
2688        int[] xOffsets = new int[]{0, 1, 0, -1, 0}, yOffsets = new int[]{1, 0, -1, 0, 1};
2689        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2690            if (on) {
2691                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2692                    ss.add((short) i);
2693                }
2694            }
2695            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2696        }
2697        on = false;
2698        idx = 0;
2699        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2700            if (on) {
2701                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2702                    x = hilbertX[i];
2703                    y = hilbertY[i];
2704                    for (int d = 0; d < 4; d++) {
2705                        for (int e = 1; e <= expansion; e++) {
2706                            for (int e2 = 0; e2 <= expansion - e; e2++) {
2707                                int j = Math.min(width - 1, Math.max(0, x + xOffsets[d] * e + yOffsets[d + 1] * e2));
2708                                int k = Math.min(height - 1, Math.max(0, y + yOffsets[d] * e + xOffsets[d + 1] * e2));
2709                                dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
2710                                if (ss.add(dist))
2711                                    vla.add(dist);
2712                            }
2713                        }
2714                    }
2715
2716                }
2717            }
2718            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2719        }
2720        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
2721        if(indices.length < 1)
2722            return ALL_WALL;
2723        Arrays.sort(indices);
2724
2725        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
2726        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
2727
2728        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
2729        for (int i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
2730            current = indices[i];
2731            if (current - past > 1)
2732            {
2733                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
2734                skip = 0;
2735                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
2736            }
2737            else if(current != past)
2738                skip++;
2739            past = current;
2740        }
2741        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
2742
2743        return vla.toArray();

2745    /**
2746     * Finds the area around the cells encoded in packed, without including those cells. For each "on"
2747     * position in packed, expand it to cover a a square with side length equal to 1 + expansion * 2,
2748     * centered on the original "on" position, unless the expansion would take a cell further than 0,
2749     * width - 1 (for xMove) or height - 1 (for yMove), in which case that cell is removed if drop is
2750     * true, or stopped at the edge if drop is false.
2751     * If a cell is "on" in packed, it will always be "off" in the result.
2752     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify packed.
2753     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
2754     * @param expansion the positive (square-shaped) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by
2755     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
2756     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
2757     * @param eightWay true if the expansion should be both diagonal and orthogonal; false for just orthogonal
2758     * @param drop true to drop cells that would expand into negative coordinates or past width/height, false to stop
2759     *             their expansion early
2760     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that were pushed from the edge of packed's "on" cells
2761     */
2762    public static short[] fringe(short[] packed, int expansion, int width, int height, boolean eightWay, boolean drop)
2763    {
2764        if(!drop)
2765            return fringe(packed, expansion, width, height, eightWay);
2766        if(packed == null || packed.length <= 1)
2767        {
2768            return ALL_WALL;
2769        }
2770        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
2771        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(256);
2772        boolean on = false;
2773        int idx = 0;
2774        short x, y, dist;
2775        int[] xOffsets = new int[]{0, 1, 0, -1, 0}, yOffsets = new int[]{1, 0, -1, 0, 1};
2776        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2777            if (on) {
2778                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2779                    ss.add((short) i);
2780                }
2781            }
2782            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2783        }
2784        on = false;
2785        idx = 0;
2786        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2787            if (on) {
2788                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2789                    x = hilbertX[i];
2790                    y = hilbertY[i];
2791                    if (eightWay) {
2792                        for (int j = x - expansion; j <= x + expansion; j++) {
2793                            for (int k = y - expansion; k <= y + expansion; k++) {
2794                                if (j >= 0 && k >= 0 && j < width && k < height) {
2795                                    dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
2796                                    if (ss.add(dist))
2797                                        vla.add(dist);
2798                                }
2799                            }
2800                        }
2801                    } else {
2802                        for (int d = 0; d < 4; d++) {
2803                            for (int e = 1; e <= expansion; e++) {
2804                                for (int e2 = 0; e2 <= expansion - e; e2++) {
2805                                    int j = x + xOffsets[d] * e + yOffsets[d + 1] * e2;
2806                                    int k = y + yOffsets[d] * e + xOffsets[d + 1] * e2;
2807
2808                                    if (j >= 0 && k >= 0 && j < width && k < height) {
2809                                        dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
2810                                        if (ss.add(dist))
2811                                            vla.add(dist);
2812                                    }
2813                                }
2814                            }
2815                        }
2816                    }
2817
2818                }
2819            }
2820            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2821        }
2822        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
2823        if(indices.length < 1)
2824            return ALL_WALL;
2825        Arrays.sort(indices);
2826
2827        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
2828        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
2829
2830        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
2831        for (int i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
2832            current = indices[i];
2833            if (current - past > 1)
2834            {
2835                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
2836                skip = 0;
2837                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
2838            }
2839            else if(current != past)
2840                skip++;
2841            past = current;
2842        }
2843        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
2844
2845        return vla.toArray();
2846    }

2848    /**
2849     * Finds the concentric areas around the cells encoded in packed, without including those cells. For each "on"
2850     * position in packed, expand it to cover a a square with side length equal to 1 + n * 2, where n starts at 1 and
2851     * goes up to include the expansions parameter, with each expansion centered on the original "on" position, unless
2852     * the expansion would take a cell further than 0, width - 1 (for xMove) or height - 1 (for yMove), in which case
2853     * that cell is stopped at the edge. If a cell is "on" in packed, it will always be "off" in the results.
2854     * Returns a new packed short[][] where the outer array has length equal to expansions and the inner arrays are
2855     * packed data encoding a one-cell-wide concentric fringe region. Uses 8-way measurement. Does not modify packed.
2856     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
2857     * @param expansions the positive (square-shaped) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by, also the length
2858     *                   of the outer array returned by this method
2859     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
2860     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
2861     * @return an array of packed arrays that encode "on" for cells that were pushed from the edge of packed's "on"
2862     *          cells; the outer array will have length equal to expansions, and inner arrays will normal packed data
2863     */
2864    public static short[][] fringes(short[] packed, int expansions, int width, int height) {
2865        short[][] finished = new short[expansions][];
2866        if (packed == null || packed.length <= 1) {
2867            Arrays.fill(finished, ALL_WALL);
2868            return finished;
2869        }
2870        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(256);
2871        boolean on = false;
2872        int idx = 0;
2873        short x, y, dist;
2874        for (int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2875            if (on) {
2876                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2877                    ss.add((short) i);
2878                }
2879            }
2880            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2881        }
2882        for (int expansion = 1; expansion <= expansions; expansion++) {
2883            ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
2884            on = false;
2885            idx = 0;
2886            for (int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
2887                if (on) {
2888                    for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
2889                        x = hilbertX[i];
2890                        y = hilbertY[i];
2891                        for (int j = Math.max(0, x - expansion); j <= Math.min(width - 1, x + expansion); j++) {
2892                            for (int k = Math.max(0, y - expansion); k <= Math.min(height - 1, y + expansion); k++) {
2893                                dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
2894                                if (ss.add(dist))
2895                                    vla.add(dist);
2896                            }
2897                        }
2898                    }
2899                }
2900                idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
2901            }
2902            int[] indices = vla.asInts();
2903            if(indices.length < 1)
2904            {
2905                finished[expansion - 1] = ALL_WALL;
2906                continue;
2907            }
2908            Arrays.sort(indices);
2909
2910            vla = new ShortVLA(128);
2911            int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
2912
2913            vla.add((short) indices[0]);
2914            for (int i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
2915                current = indices[i];
2916                if (current - past > 1)
2917                {
2918                    vla.add((short) (skip+1));
2919                    skip = 0;
2920                    vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
2921                }
2922                else if(current != past)
2923                    skip++;
2924                past = current;
2925            }
2926            vla.add((short) (skip + 1));
2927
2928            finished[expansion-1] = vla.toArray();
2929        }
2930        return finished;
2931    }

2980                        y = hilbertY[i];

2986                                    dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
2987                                    if (ss.add(dist))
2988                                        vla.add(dist);
2989                                }

2995            }

2997            if(indices.length < 1)
2998            {

3027    /**
3028     * Finds the area consisting of the "on" positions in packed that are within the specified depth distance of an
3029     * "off" position or the edge of the map. This essentially finds the part of packed that is close to its edge.
3030     * Uses 8-way movement (Chebyshev distance) unless the overload of this function that takes a boolean argument
3031     * eightWay is used and that argument is false.
3032     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify packed.
3033     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
3034     * @param depth the positive (square) radius, in cells, to go inward from an "off" cell into the "in" cells
3035     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
3036     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
3037     * @return a short[] that encodes "on" for cells that were "on" in packed and were close enough to an "off" cell
3038     */
3039    public static short[] surface(short[] packed, int depth, int width, int height)
3040    {
3041        return intersectPacked(packed, expand(negatePacked(packed), depth, width, height, true));
3042    }

3052            if (on) {

3054                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++)
3055                {
3056                    x = hilbertX[i];
3057                    y = hilbertY[i];
3058                    for (int j = Math.max(0, x - depth); j <= Math.min(width - 1, x + depth); j++) {
3059                        for (int k = Math.max(0, y - depth); k <= Math.min(height - 1, y + depth); k++) {
3060                            if(!queryPackedHilbert(packed, hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)]))
3061                            {
3062                                vla.add((short)i);
3063                                continue INDICES;
3064                            }
3065                        }
3066                    }
3067                }
3068            }
3069            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
3070        }
3071
3072        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
3073        if(indices.length < 1)
3074            return ALL_WALL;
3075        Arrays.sort(indices);
3076
3077        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
3078        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
3079

3086                skip = 0;

3088            }

3090                skip++;
3091            past = current;
3092        }
3093        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
3094        return vla.toArray();
