3097    /**
3098     * Finds the area consisting of the "on" positions in packed that are within the specified depth distance of an
3099     * "off" position or the edge of the map. This essentially finds the part of packed that is close to its edge.
3100     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify packed.
3101     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
3102     * @param depth the positive (square) radius, in cells, to go inward from an "off" cell into the "in" cells
3103     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
3104     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
3105     * @param eightWay true if the retraction should be both diagonal and orthogonal; false for just orthogonal
3106     * @return a short[] that encodes "on" for cells that were "on" in packed and were close enough to an "off" cell
3107     */
3108    public static short[] surface(short[] packed, int depth, int width, int height, boolean eightWay)
3109    {
3110        return intersectPacked(packed, expand(negatePacked(packed), depth, width, height, eightWay));
3111    }
3112    /**
3113     * Finds the concentric, progressively-smaller surfaces of packed as if packed was shrinking with each iteration.
3114     * Essentially, this is the inverse of fringes, where fringe finds a ring around packed and fringes finds concentric
3115     * rings around growing versions of packed, while surface finds a ring at the edge and surfaces finds rings at the
3116     * edge of shrinking versions of packed.
3117     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify packed.
3118     * @param packed a short[] returned by pack() or one of the sub-arrays in what is returned by packMulti()
3119     * @param depth the positive (square) radius, in cells, to go inward from an "off" cell into the "in" cells
3120     * @param width the maximum width; if a cell would move to x at least equal to width, it stops at width - 1
3121     * @param height the maximum height; if a cell would move to y at least equal to height, it stops at height - 1
3122     * @return an array of packed short[] that each encodes "on" for cells that were "on" in packed and were at a
3123     * distance between 1 and depth to an "off" cell
3124     */
3125    public static short[][] surfaces(short[] packed, int depth, int width, int height)
3126    {
3127        short[][] sfs = new short[depth][], frs = fringes(negatePacked(packed), depth, width, height);
3128        for (int i = 0; i < depth; i++) {
3129            sfs[i] = intersectPacked(packed, frs[i]);
3130        }
3131        return sfs;
3132    }

3150        for (int i = 0; i < depth; i++) {
3151            sfs[i] = intersectPacked(packed, frs[i]);

3218    /**
3219     * Given a packed array encoding a larger area, a packed array encoding one or more points inside bounds, and an
3220     * amount of expansion, expands each cell in start by a Manhattan (diamond) radius equal to expansion, limiting any
3221     * expansion to within bounds and returning the final expanded (limited) packed data.  Notably, if a small area is
3222     * not present within bounds, then the flood will move around the "hole" similarly to DijkstraMap's behavior;
3223     * essentially, it needs to expand around the hole to get to the other side, and this takes more steps of expansion
3224     * than crossing straight over.
3225     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify bounds or start.
3226     * @param bounds packed data representing the maximum extent of the region to flood-fill; often floors
3227     * @param start a packed array that encodes position(s) that the flood will spread outward from
3228     * @param expansion the positive (square) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by
3229     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that are "on" in bounds and are within expansion Manhattan
3230     * distance from a Coord in start
3231     */
3232    public static short[] flood(short[] bounds, short[] start, int expansion)
3233    {
3234        if(bounds == null || bounds.length <= 1)
3235        {
3236            return ALL_WALL;
3237        }
3238        int boundSize = count(bounds);
3239        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
3240        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(boundSize), quickBounds = new ShortSet(boundSize);
3241        boolean on = false, justAdded;
3242        int idx = 0;
3243        short x, y, dist;
3244        for(int p = 0; p < bounds.length; p++, on = !on) {
3245            if (on) {
3246                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (bounds[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
3247                    quickBounds.add((short) i);
3248                }
3249            }
3250            idx += bounds[p] & 0xffff;
3251        }
3252        short[] s2 = allPackedHilbert(start);
3253        ss.addAll(s2);
3254        vla.addAll(s2);
3255        int[] xOffsets = new int[]{0, 1, 0, -1}, yOffsets = new int[]{1, 0, -1, 0};
3256        for (int e = 0; e < expansion; e++) {
3257            justAdded = false;
3258            ShortVLA edge = new ShortVLA(128);
3259            for (int s = 0; s < s2.length; s++) {
3260                int i = s2[s] & 0xffff;
3261                x = hilbertX[i];
3262                y = hilbertY[i];
3263
3264                for (int d = 0; d < 4; d++) {
3265                    int j = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, x + xOffsets[d]));
3266                    int k = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, y + yOffsets[d]));
3267                    dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
3268                    if (quickBounds.contains(dist)) {
3269                        if (ss.add(dist)) {
3270                            vla.add(dist);
3271                            edge.add(dist);
3272                            justAdded = true;
3273                        }
3274                    }
3275                }
3276            }
3277            if(!justAdded)
3278                break;
3279            s2 = edge.toArray();
3280        }
3281
3282        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
3283        if(indices.length < 1)
3284            return ALL_WALL;
3285        Arrays.sort(indices);
3286
3287        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
3288        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
3289
3290        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
3291        for (int i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
3292            current = indices[i];
3293            if (current - past > 1)
3294            {
3295                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
3296                skip = 0;
3297                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
3298            }
3299            else if(current != past)
3300                skip++;
3301            past = current;
3302        }
3303        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
3304
3305        return vla.toArray();
3306    }
3307
3308
3309    /**
3310     * Given a packed array encoding a larger area, a packed array encoding one or more points inside bounds, and an
3311     * amount of expansion, expands each cell in start by a radius (if eightWay is true, it uses Chebyshev distance; if
3312     * it is false, it uses Manhattan distance) equal to expansion, limiting any expansion to within bounds and
3313     * returning the final expanded (limited) packed data. Notably, if a small area is not present within bounds, then
3314     * the flood will move around the "hole" similarly to DijkstraMap's behavior; essentially, it needs to expand around
3315     * the hole to get to the other side, and this takes more steps of expansion than crossing straight over.
3316     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify bounds or start.
3317     * @param bounds packed data representing the maximum extent of the region to flood-fill; often floors
3318     * @param start a packed array that encodes position(s) that the flood will spread outward from
3319     * @param expansion the positive (square) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by
3320     * @param eightWay true to flood-fill out in all eight directions at each step, false for just orthogonal
3321     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that are "on" in bounds and are within expansion either
3322     * Chebyshev (if eightWay is true) or Manhattan (otherwise) distance from a Coord in start
3323     */
3324    public static short[] flood(short[] bounds, short[] start, int expansion, boolean eightWay)
3325    {
3326        if(!eightWay)
3327            return flood(bounds, start, expansion);
3328        if(bounds == null || bounds.length <= 1)
3329        {
3330            return ALL_WALL;
3331        }
3332        int boundSize = count(bounds);
3333        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
3334        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(boundSize), quickBounds = new ShortSet(boundSize);
3335        boolean on = false, justAdded;
3336        int idx = 0;
3337        short x, y, dist;
3338        for(int p = 0; p < bounds.length; p++, on = !on) {
3339            if (on) {
3340                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (bounds[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
3341                    quickBounds.add((short) i);
3342                }
3343            }
3344            idx += bounds[p] & 0xffff;
3345        }
3346        short[] s2 = allPackedHilbert(start);
3347        ss.addAll(s2);
3348        vla.addAll(s2);
3349        int[] xOffsets = new int[]{-1, 0, 1, -1,    1, -1, 0, 1}, yOffsets = new int[]{-1, -1, -1, 0,    0, 1, 1, 1};
3350        for (int e = 0; e < expansion; e++) {
3351            justAdded = false;
3352            ShortVLA edge = new ShortVLA(128);
3353            for (int s = 0; s < s2.length; s++) {
3354                int i = s2[s] & 0xffff;
3355                x = hilbertX[i];
3356                y = hilbertY[i];
3357                for (int d = 0; d < 8; d++) {
3358                    int j = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, x + xOffsets[d]));
3359                    int k = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, y + yOffsets[d]));
3360                    dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
3361                    if (quickBounds.contains(dist)) {
3362                        if (ss.add(dist)) {
3363                            vla.add(dist);
3364                            edge.add(dist);
3365                            justAdded = true;
3366                        }
3367                    }
3368                }
3369            }
3370            if(!justAdded)
3371                break;
3372            s2 = edge.toArray();
3373        }
3374
3375        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
3376        if(indices.length < 1)
3377            return ALL_WALL;
3378        Arrays.sort(indices);
3379
3380        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
3381        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
3382
3383        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
3384        for (int i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
3385            current = indices[i];
3386            if (current - past > 1)
3387            {
3388                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
3389                skip = 0;
3390                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
3391            }
3392            else if(current != past)
3393                skip++;
3394            past = current;
3395        }
3396        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
3397
3398        return vla.toArray();
3399    }
3400
3401
3402    /**
3403     * Given a packed array encoding a larger area, a packed array encoding one or more points inside bounds, an IRNG,
3404     * and a volume in cells, expands a random cell in start in a random Manhattan (diamond) direction equal, then
3405     * continues to expand from random cells in start or the expanded area until it has filled volume cells, limiting
3406     * any expansion to within bounds and returning the final expanded (limited) packed data.  Notably, if a small area
3407     * is not present within bounds, then the spill will move around the "hole" similarly to DijkstraMap's behavior;
3408     * essentially, it needs to expand around the hole to get to the other side, and this takes more steps of expansion
3409     * than crossing straight over.
3410     * <br>
3411     * Could also be given a name like randomizedFlood(), but spill() is used by the Spill class that does this too.
3412     * <br>
3413     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify bounds or start.
3414     * @param bounds packed data representing the maximum extent of the region to random-flood-fill; often floors
3415     * @param start a packed array that encodes position(s) that the random-flood will spread outward from
3416     * @param volume the total number of cells to try to fill
3417     * @param rng the {@link IRNG}, such as an {@link RNG} or {@link GWTRNG}, used to generate random numbers for the flooding
3418     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that are "on" in bounds and are within expansion Manhattan
3419     * distance from a Coord in start
3420     */
3421    public static short[] spill(short[] bounds, short[] start, int volume, IRNG rng)
3422    {
3423        if(bounds == null || bounds.length <= 1)
3424        {
3425            return ALL_WALL;
3426        }
3427        int boundSize = count(bounds);
3428        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
3429        ShortSet ss = new ShortSet(boundSize), edge = new ShortSet(boundSize), quickBounds = new ShortSet(boundSize);
3430        boolean on = false;
3431        int idx = 0;
3432        short x, y, dist;
3433        for(int p = 0; p < bounds.length; p++, on = !on) {
3434            if (on) {
3435                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (bounds[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
3436                    quickBounds.add((short) i);
3437                }
3438            }
3439            idx += bounds[p] & 0xffff;
3440        }
3441        short[] s2 = allPackedHilbert(start);
3442        int ct = s2.length;
3443        ss.addAll(s2);
3444        vla.addAll(s2);
3445        edge.addAll(allPackedHilbert(intersectPacked(bounds, fringe(start, 1, 256, 256, false))));
3446        ss.addAll(edge);
3447        if(edge.size <= 0)
3448        {
3449            if(!intersects(bounds, start))
3450                return ALL_WALL;
3451
3452            short[] cpy = new short[start.length];
3453            System.arraycopy(start, 0, cpy, 0, start.length);
3454            return cpy;
3455        }
3456        int[] xOffsets = new int[]{0, 1, 0, -1}, yOffsets = new int[]{1, 0, -1, 0};
3457        for (int v = ct; v < volume; v++) {
3458            short s = edge.random(rng);
3459
3460            edge.remove(s);
3461            vla.add(s);
3462            int i = s & 0xffff;
3463            x = hilbertX[i];
3464            y = hilbertY[i];
3465
3466            for (int d = 0; d < 4; d++) {
3467                int j = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, x + xOffsets[d]));
3468                int k = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, y + yOffsets[d]));
3469                dist = hilbertDistances[j + (k << 8)];
3470                if (quickBounds.contains(dist)) {
3471                    if (ss.add(dist)) {
3472                        edge.add(dist);
3473                    }
3474                }
3475            }
3476
3477            if(edge.size <= 0)
3478                break;
3479        }
3480
3481        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
3482        if(indices.length < 1)
3483            return ALL_WALL;
3484        Arrays.sort(indices);
3485
3486        vla.clear();
3487        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
3488
3489        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
3490        for (int i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
3491            current = indices[i];
3492            if (current - past > 1)
3493            {
3494                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
3495                skip = 0;
3496                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
3497            }
3498            else if(current != past)
3499                skip++;
3500            past = current;
3501        }
3502        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
3503
3504        return vla.toArray();
3505    }
3506
3507    private static void modifiedShadowFOV(int expansion, int viewerX, int viewerY, Radius metric, ShortSet bounds, ShortSet storedSet, ShortVLA vla)
3508    {
3509        if(expansion < 1)
3510            return;
3511        short start = hilbertDistances[viewerX + (viewerY << 8)];
3512        if(storedSet.add(start))
3513            vla.add(start);
3514
3515        for (Direction d : Direction.DIAGONALS) {
3516            modifiedShadowCast(expansion, 1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, d.deltaX, d.deltaY, 0, viewerX, viewerY, metric, bounds, storedSet, vla);
3517            modifiedShadowCast(expansion, 1, 1.0, 0.0, d.deltaX, 0, 0, d.deltaY, viewerX, viewerY, metric, bounds, storedSet, vla);
3518        }
3519    }
3520
3521    private static void modifiedShadowCast(int expansion, int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
3522                                     int viewerX, int viewerY, Radius metric, ShortSet bounds, ShortSet storedSet, ShortVLA vla) {
3523        double newStart = 0;
3524        if (start < end) {
3525            return;
3526        }
3527
3528        boolean blocked = false;
3529        int dist;
3530        short currentPos;
3531        for (int distance = row; distance <= expansion && !blocked; distance++) {
3532            int deltaY = -distance;
3533            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
3534                int currentX = viewerX + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
3535                int currentY = viewerY + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
3536                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
3537                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
3538                currentPos = hilbertDistances[currentX + (currentY << 8)];
3539
3540                /*
3541                if (!bounds.contains(currentPos)) {
3542                    newStart = rightSlope;
3543                    continue;
3544                }
3545                else
3546                 */
3547                if(!(currentX - viewerX + expansion >= 0 && currentX - viewerX <= expansion
3548                        && currentY - viewerY + expansion >= 0 && currentY - viewerY <= expansion)
3549                        || start < rightSlope) {
3550                    continue;
3551                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
3552                    break;
3553                }
3554
3555                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
3556                    if (!bounds.contains(currentPos)) {//hit a wall
3557                        newStart = rightSlope;
3558                    } else {
3559                        blocked = false;
3560                        start = newStart;
3561                        dist = metric.roughDistance(currentX - viewerX, currentY - viewerY);
3562                        //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
3563                        if (dist <= expansion * 2) {
3564                            if(storedSet.add(currentPos))
3565                                vla.add(currentPos);
3566                        }
3567                    }
3568                } else {
3569                    if (!bounds.contains(currentPos) && distance < expansion) {//hit a wall within sight line
3570                        blocked = true;
3571                        modifiedShadowCast(expansion, distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, viewerX, viewerY, metric, bounds, storedSet, vla);
3572                        newStart = rightSlope;
3573                    }
3574                    else
3575                    {
3576                        if(bounds.contains(currentPos)) {
3577                            dist = metric.roughDistance(currentX - viewerX, currentY - viewerY);
3578                            //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
3579                            if (dist <= expansion * 2) {
3580                                if (storedSet.add(currentPos))
3581                                    vla.add(currentPos);
3582                            }
3583                        }
3584                    }
3585                }
3586            }
3587        }
3588    }
3589
3590    /**
3591     * Given a packed array encoding a larger area, a packed array encoding one or more points inside bounds, and an
3592     * amount of expansion, expands each cell in start by a Manhattan (diamond) radius equal to expansion, limiting any
3593     * expansion to within bounds and returning the final expanded (limited) packed data.
3594     * Though this is otherwise similar to flood(), radiate() behaves like FOV and will not move around obstacles and
3595     * will instead avoid expanding if it would go into any cell that cannot be reached by a straight line (drawn
3596     * directly, not in grid steps) that is mostly unobstructed.
3597     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify bounds or start.
3598     * @param bounds packed data representing the maximum extent of the region to flood-fill; often floors
3599     * @param start a packed array that encodes position(s) that the flood will spread outward from
3600     * @param expansion the positive (square) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by
3601     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that are "on" in bounds and are within expansion Manhattan
3602     * distance from a Coord in start
3603     */
3604    public static short[] radiate(short[] bounds, short[] start, int expansion)
3605    {
3606        return radiate(bounds, start, expansion, Radius.DIAMOND);
3607    }
3608    /**
3609     * Given a packed array encoding a larger area, a packed array encoding one or more points inside bounds, and an
3610     * amount of expansion, expands each cell in start by a radius, with a shape determined by metric, equal to
3611     * expansion, limiting any expansion to within bounds and returning the final expanded (limited) packed data.
3612     * Though this is otherwise similar to flood(), radiate() behaves like FOV and will not move around obstacles and
3613     * will instead avoid expanding if it would go into any cell that cannot be reached by a straight line (drawn
3614     * directly, not in grid steps) that is mostly unobstructed.
3615     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify bounds or start.
3616     * @param bounds packed data representing the maximum extent of the region to flood-fill; often floors
3617     * @param start a packed array that encodes position(s) that the flood will spread outward from
3618     * @param expansion the positive (square) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by
3619     * @param metric a Radius that defines how this should expand, SQUARE for 8-way, DIAMOND for 4-way, CIRCLE for
3620     *               Euclidean expansion (not guaranteed to be perfectly circular)
3621     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that are "on" in bounds and are within expansion Manhattan
3622     * distance from a Coord in start
3623     */
3624    public static short[] radiate(short[] bounds, short[] start, int expansion, Radius metric)
3625    {
3626        if(bounds == null || bounds.length <= 1)
3627        {
3628            return ALL_WALL;
3629        }
3630        int boundSize = count(bounds);
3631        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256);
3632        ShortSet storedSet = new ShortSet(boundSize), quickBounds = new ShortSet(boundSize);
3633        boolean on = false;
3634        int idx = 0, i;
3635        short x, y;
3636        for(int p = 0; p < bounds.length; p++, on = !on) {
3637            if (on) {
3638                for (i = idx; i < idx + (bounds[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
3639                    quickBounds.add((short) i);
3640                }
3641            }
3642            idx += bounds[p] & 0xffff;
3643        }
3644        short[] s2 = allPackedHilbert(start);
3645        for (int s = 0; s < s2.length; s++) {
3646            i = s2[s] & 0xffff;
3647            x = hilbertX[i];
3648            y = hilbertY[i];
3649
3650            modifiedShadowFOV(expansion, x, y, metric, quickBounds, storedSet, vla);
3651        }
3652
3653        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
3654        if(indices.length < 1)
3655            return ALL_WALL;
3656        Arrays.sort(indices);
3657
3658        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
3659        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
3660
3661        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
3662        for (i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
3663            current = indices[i];
3664            if (current - past > 1)
3665            {
3666                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
3667                skip = 0;
3668                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
3669            }
3670            else if(current != past)
3671                skip++;
3672            past = current;
3673        }
3674        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
3675
3676        return vla.toArray();
3677    }
3678
3679
3680    /**
3681     * Given a packed array encoding a larger area, a packed array encoding one or more points inside bounds, and an
3682     * amount of expansion, expands each cell in start by a radius, with a square shape if eightWay is true or a diamond
3683     * otherwise, equal to expansion, limiting any expansion to within bounds and returning the final expanded (limited)
3684     * packed data. Though this is otherwise similar to flood(), radiate() behaves like FOV and will not move around
3685     * obstacles and will instead avoid expanding if it would go into any cell that cannot be reached by a straight line
3686     * (drawn directly, not in grid steps) that is mostly unobstructed.
3687     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify bounds or start.
3688     * @param bounds packed data representing the maximum extent of the region to flood-fill; often floors
3689     * @param start a packed array that encodes position(s) that the flood will spread outward from
3690     * @param expansion the positive (square) radius, in cells, to expand each cell out by
3691     * @param eightWay true to flood-fill out in all eight directions at each step, false for just orthogonal
3692     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that are "on" in bounds and are within expansion either
3693     * Chebyshev (if eightWay is true) or Manhattan (otherwise) distance from a Coord in start
3694     */
3695    public static short[] radiate(short[] bounds, short[] start, int expansion, boolean eightWay)
3696    {
3697        if(eightWay)
3698            return radiate(bounds, start, expansion, Radius.SQUARE);
3699        return radiate(bounds, start, expansion, Radius.DIAMOND);
3700    }
3701
3702    /**
3703     * Given a packed array encoding a larger area, a packed array encoding one or more points inside bounds, and a
3704     * Reach object that determines targeting constraints, gets all cells contained within bounds that can be targeted
3705     * from a cell in start using the rules defined by reach.
3706     * Though this is otherwise similar to flood(), reachable() behaves like FOV and will not move around obstacles and
3707     * will instead avoid expanding if it would go into any cell that cannot be reached by a straight line (drawn
3708     * directly, not in grid steps) that is mostly unobstructed. This does not behave quite like FOV if an AimLimit has
3709     * been set in reach to any value other than null or AimLimit.FREE; in these cases it requires an exactly straight
3710     * orthogonal or diagonal line without obstructions, checking only cells along the precise path. For diagonals and
3711     * eight-way targeting, this means it can target through walls that only meet at a perpendicular diagonal, such as
3712     * an X shape where one line is a one-cell-thick diagonal wall and the other is the targeting line. This is normally
3713     * only allowed in some games and only if they use Chebyshev (Radius.SQUARE) distance, so be advised that it may not
3714     * be desirable behavior.
3715     * Returns a new packed short[] and does not modify bounds or start.
3716     * @param bounds packed data representing the max extent of the region to check for reach-ability; often floors
3717     * @param start a packed array that encodes position(s) that the flood will spread outward from
3718     * @param reach a {@link Reach} object that determines minimum and maximum range, distance metric, and AimLimit
3719     * @return a packed array that encodes "on" for cells that are "on" in bounds and can be targeted from a cell in
3720     * start using the given Reach
3721     */
3722    public static short[] reachable(short[] bounds, short[] start, Reach reach)
3723    {
3724        if(bounds == null || bounds.length <= 1)
3725        {
3726            return ALL_WALL;
3727        }
3728        int boundSize = count(bounds);
3729        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(256), discard = new ShortVLA(128);
3730        ShortSet storedSet = new ShortSet(boundSize), quickBounds = new ShortSet(boundSize);
3731        boolean on = false;
3732        int idx = 0, i;
3733        short x, y;
3734        for(int p = 0; p < bounds.length; p++, on = !on) {
3735            if (on) {
3736                for (i = idx; i < idx + (bounds[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
3737                    quickBounds.add((short) i);
3738                }
3739            }
3740            idx += bounds[p] & 0xffff;
3741        }
3742        short[] s2 = allPackedHilbert(start);
3743        if(reach.limit == null || reach.limit == AimLimit.FREE) {
3744            for (int s = 0; s < s2.length; s++) {
3745                i = s2[s] & 0xffff;
3746                x = hilbertX[i];
3747                y = hilbertY[i];
3748                //add all cells at less than minimum distance to storedSet.
3749                modifiedShadowFOV(reach.minDistance - 1, x, y, reach.metric, quickBounds, storedSet, discard);
3750                discard.clear();
3751                modifiedShadowFOV(reach.maxDistance, x, y, reach.metric, quickBounds, storedSet, vla);
3752            }
3753        }
3754        else
3755        {
3756            for (int s = 0; s < s2.length; s++) {
3757                i = s2[s] & 0xffff;
3758                x = hilbertX[i];
3759                y = hilbertY[i];
3760                Direction[] dirs;
3761                switch (reach.limit)
3762                {
3763                    case ORTHOGONAL: dirs = Direction.CARDINALS;
3764                        break;
3765                    case DIAGONAL: dirs = Direction.DIAGONALS;
3766                        break;
3767                    default: dirs = Direction.OUTWARDS;
3768                }
3769                Direction dir;
3770                DIRECTIONAL:
3771                for (int which = 0; which < dirs.length; which++) {
3772                    dir = dirs[which];
3773                    int d;
3774                    //add all cells at less than minimum distance to storedSet.
3775                    for (d = 1; d < reach.minDistance; d++) {
3776                        int extended = (x + dir.deltaX * d) + ((y + dir.deltaY * d) << 8);
3777                        if (extended < 0 || extended > 0xffff)
3778                            continue DIRECTIONAL;
3779                        short next = hilbertDistances[extended];
3780                        if (quickBounds.contains(next))
3781                            storedSet.add(next);
3782                        else
3783                            continue DIRECTIONAL;
3784                    }
3785                    for (; d <= reach.maxDistance; d++) {
3786                        int extended = (x + dir.deltaX * d) + ((y + dir.deltaY * d) << 8);
3787                        if (extended < 0 || extended > 0xffff)
3788                            continue DIRECTIONAL;
3789                        short next = hilbertDistances[extended];
3790                        if (quickBounds.contains(next)) {
3791                            if (storedSet.add(next))
3792                                vla.add(next);
3793                        }
3794                        else
3795                            continue DIRECTIONAL;
3796                    }
3797                }
3798            }
3799        }
3800        int[] indices = vla.asInts();
3801        if(indices.length < 1)
3802            return ALL_WALL;
3803        Arrays.sort(indices);
3804
3805        vla = new ShortVLA(128);
3806        int current, past = indices[0], skip = 0;
3807
3808        vla.add((short)indices[0]);
3809        for (i = 1; i < indices.length; i++) {
3810            current = indices[i];
3811            if (current - past > 1)
3812            {
3813                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
3814                skip = 0;
3815                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
3816            }
3817            else if(current != past)
3818                skip++;
3819            past = current;
3820        }
3821        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
3822
3823        return vla.toArray();
3824    }
3825    /**
3826     * Given a width and height, returns a packed array that encodes "on" for the rectangle from (0,0) to
3827     * (width - 1, height - 1). Primarily useful with intersectPacked() to ensure things like negatePacked() that can
3828     * encode "on" cells in any position are instead limited to the bounds of the map.
3829     * @param width the width of the rectangle
3830     * @param height the height of the rectangle
3831     * @return a packed short[] encoding "on" for all cells with x less than width and y less than height.
3832     */
3833    public static short[] rectangle(int width, int height)
3834    {
3835        if(width > 256 || height > 256)
3836            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Map size is too large to efficiently pack, aborting");
3837        boolean[][] rect = new boolean[width][height];
3838        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
3839            Arrays.fill(rect[i], true);
3840        }
3841        return pack(rect);
3842    }
3843    /**
3844     * Given x, y, width and height, returns a packed array that encodes "on" for the rectangle from (x,y) to
3845     * (width + x - 1, height + y - 1). Primarily useful with intersectPacked() to ensure things like negatePacked() that
3846     * can encode "on" cells in any position are instead limited to the bounds of the map, but also handy for basic "box
3847     * drawing" for other uses.
3848     * @param x the minimum x coordinate
3849     * @param y the minimum y coordinate
3850     * @param width the width of the rectangle
3851     * @param height the height of the rectangle
3852     * @return a packed short[] encoding "on" for all cells between (x,y) and (x+width-1,y+height-1).
3853     */
3854    public static short[] rectangle(int x, int y, int width, int height)
3855    {
3856        int width2 = width, height2 = height;
3857        if(x + width >= 256)
3858            width2 = 255 - x;
3859        if(y + height >= 256)
3860            height2 = 255 - y;
3861        if(width2 < 0 || height2 < 0 || x < 0 || y < 0)
3862            return ALL_WALL;
3863        boolean[][] rect = new boolean[x + width2][y + height2];
3864        for (int i = x; i < x + width2; i++) {
3865            Arrays.fill(rect[i], y, y + height2, true);
3866        }
3867        return pack(rect);
3868    }
3869    /**
3870     * Given x, y, width and height, returns an array of all Hilbert distance within the rectangle from (x,y) to
3871     * (width + x - 1, height + y - 1).
3872     * @param x the minimum x coordinate
3873     * @param y the minimum y coordinate
3874     * @param width the width of the rectangle
3875     * @param height the height of the rectangle
3876     * @return a short[] that is not packed, and instead stores individual Hilbert distances in the rectangle
3877     */
3878    public static short[] rectangleHilbert(int x, int y, int width, int height)
3879    {
3880        int width2 = width, height2 = height;
3881        if(x + width >= 256)
3882            width2 = 256 - x;
3883        if(y + height >= 256)
3884            height2 = 256 - y;
3885        if(width2 <= 0 || height2 <= 0 || x < 0 || y < 0)
3886            return new short[0];
3887        short[] hilberts = new short[width2 * height2];
3888        int idx = 0;
3889        for (int i = x; i < x + width2; i++) {
3890            for (int j = y; j < y + height2; j++) {
3891                hilberts[idx++] = hilbertDistances[i + (j << 8)];
3892            }
3893        }
3894        return hilberts;
3895    }
3896
3897    /**
3898     * Given a center and radius for a circle, plus the width and height for the map boundaries, returns the packed data
3899     * that encodes the circle.
3900     * @param center center position of the circle
3901     * @param radius radius to extend in all directions from center
3902     * @param width the maximum width of the map (exclusive); the circle will not extend past this or below 0
3903     * @param height the maximum height of the map (exclusive); the circle will not extend past this or below 0
3904     * @return a packed short[] encoding "on" for all elements inside the circle
3905     */
3906    public static short[] circle(Coord center, int radius, int width, int height)
3907    {
3908        return packSeveral(Radius.CIRCLE.pointsInside(center, radius, false, width, height));
3909    }
3910    /**
3911     * Counts the number of "on" cells encoded in a packed array without unpacking it.
3912     * @param packed a packed short array, as produced by pack()
3913     * @return the number of "on" cells.
3914     */
3915    public static int count(short[] packed)
3916    {
3917        return count(packed, true);
3918    }
3919
3920    /**
3921     * Counts the number of cells encoding a boolean equal to wanted in a packed array without unpacking it.
3922     * @param packed a packed short array, as produced by pack()
3923     * @param wanted the boolean you want to count, true for "on" and false for "off"
3924     * @return the number of cells that encode a value equal to wanted.
3925     */
3926    public static int count(short[] packed, boolean wanted)
3927    {
3928        int c = 0;
3929        boolean on = false;
3930        for (int i = 0; i < packed.length; i++, on = !on) {
3931            if(on == wanted)
3932                c += packed[i] & 0xffff;
3933        }
3934        return c;
3935    }
3936    /**
3937     * Finds how many cells are encoded in a packed array (both on and off) without unpacking it.
3938     * @param packed a packed short array, as produced by pack()
3939     * @return the number of cells that are encoded explicitly in the packed data as either on or off.
3940     */
3941    public static int covered(short[] packed)
3942    {
3943        int c = 0;
3944        for (int i = 0; i < packed.length; i++) {
3945            c += packed[i] & 0xffff;
3946        }
3947        return c;
3948    }
3949
3950    /**
3951     * Finds the minimum bounding rectangle for a packed array without unpacking it. Returns a Coord array with 2
3952     * elements: the minimum-x/minimum-y Coord corner of the bounds, then the maximum-x/maximum-y Coord corner. Both
3953     * array elements will be the Coord (-1,-1) if the packed array does not encode any "on" values (all empty).
3954     * @param packed a packed short array, as produced by pack()
3955     * @return a 2-element Coord array starting with the bounds' minimum corner and followed by the maximum corner
3956     */
3957    public static Coord[] bounds(short[] packed)
3958    {
3959        Coord[] c = new Coord[]{Coord.get(-1,-1), Coord.get(-1,-1)};
3960        boolean on = false;
3961        int idx = 0, min_x = 256, min_y = 256, max_x = -1, max_y = -1, x, y;
3962        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
3963            if (on) {
3964                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
3965                    x = hilbertX[i];
3966                    y = hilbertY[i];
3967                    if(min_x > x)
3968                        min_x = x;
3969                    if(min_y > y)
3970                        min_y = y;
3971                    if(max_x < x)
3972                        max_x = x;
3973                    if(max_y < y)
3974                        max_y = y;
3975                }
3976            }
3977            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
3978        }
3979        if(min_x < 256) {
3980            c[0] = Coord.get(min_x, min_y);
3981            c[1] = Coord.get(max_x, max_y);
3982        }
3983        return c;
3984    }
3985
3986    /**
3987     * Given a 2D char array for a map, a piece of packed data defining a region to use from that map, and a filler
3988     * char, produces a 2D char array where all positions that are "off" in packed are filled with filler, and the rest
3989     * are the same as in map.
3990     * @param map a 2D char array that will not be modified
3991     * @param packed a packed short array, as produced by pack()
3992     * @param filler the char to use for "off" positions in packed
3993     * @return a 2D char array similar to map but with any "off" positions in packed replaced with filler
3994     */
3995    public static char[][] mask(char[][] map, short[] packed, char filler)
3996    {
3997        if(map.length <= 0)
3998            return map;
3999        char[][] c = new char[map.length][map[0].length];
4000        for (int i = 0; i < map.length; i++) {
4001            Arrays.fill(c[i], filler);
4002        }
4003        boolean on = false;
4004        int idx = 0, x, y;
4005        for(int p = 0; p < packed.length; p++, on = !on) {
4006            if (on) {
4007                for (int i = idx; i < idx + (packed[p] & 0xffff); i++) {
4008                    x = hilbertX[i];
4009                    y = hilbertY[i];
4010                    if(x >= map.length || y >= map[x].length)
4011                        continue;
4012                    c[x][y] = map[x][y];
4013                }
4014            }
4015            idx += packed[p] & 0xffff;
4016        }
4017        return c;
4018    }
4019
4020    /**
4021     * Given two packed short arrays, left and right, this produces a packed short array that encodes "on" for any cell
4022     * that was "on" in either left or in right, and only encodes "off" for cells that were off in both. This method
4023     * does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly preferred
4024     * when merging two pieces of packed data.
4025     * @param left A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4026     * @param right A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4027     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that were "on" in either left or right
4028     */
4029    public static short[] unionPacked(short[] left, short[] right)
4030    {
4031        if(left.length == 0)
4032            return right;
4033        if(right.length == 0)
4034            return left;
4035        ShortVLA packing = new ShortVLA(64);
4036        boolean on = false, onLeft = false, onRight = false;
4037        int idx = 0, skip = 0, elemLeft = 0, elemRight = 0, totalLeft = 0, totalRight = 0;
4038        while ((elemLeft < left.length || elemRight < right.length) && idx <= 0xffff) {
4039            if (elemLeft >= left.length) {
4040                totalLeft = 0x20000;
4041                onLeft = false;
4042            }
4043            else if(totalLeft <= idx) {
4044                totalLeft += left[elemLeft] & 0xffff;
4045            }
4046            if(elemRight >= right.length) {
4047                totalRight = 0x20000;
4048                onRight = false;
4049            }
4050            else if(totalRight <= idx) {
4051                totalRight += right[elemRight] & 0xffff;
4052            }
4053            // 300, 5, 6, 8, 2, 4
4054            // 290, 12, 9, 1
4055            // =
4056            // 290, 15, 6, 8, 2, 4
4057            // 290 off in both, 10 in right, 2 in both, 3 in left, 6 off in both, 1 on in both, 7 on in left, 2 off in
4058            //     both, 4 on in left
4059            if(totalLeft < totalRight)
4060            {
4061                onLeft = !onLeft;
4062                skip += totalLeft - idx;
4063                idx = totalLeft;
4064                if(on != (onLeft || onRight)) {
4065                    packing.add((short) skip);
4066                    skip = 0;
4067                    on = !on;
4068                }
4069                elemLeft++;
4070            }
4071            else if(totalLeft == totalRight)
4072            {
4073                onLeft = !onLeft;
4074                onRight = !onRight;
4075                skip += totalLeft - idx;
4076                idx = totalLeft;
4077                if(on != (onLeft || onRight)) {
4078                    packing.add((short) skip);
4079                    skip = 0;
4080                    on = !on;
4081                }
4082                elemLeft++;
4083                elemRight++;
4084
4085            }
4086            else
4087            {
4088                onRight = !onRight;
4089                skip += totalRight - idx;
4090                idx = totalRight;
4091                if(on != (onLeft || onRight)) {
4092                    packing.add((short) skip);
4093                    skip = 0;
4094                    on = !on;
4095                }
4096                elemRight++;
4097            }
4098        }
4099        return packing.toArray();
4100    }
4101
4102    /**
4103     * Given two packed short arrays, left and right, this produces a packed short array that encodes "on" for any cell
4104     * that was "on" in both left and in right, and encodes "off" for cells that were off in either array. This method
4105     * does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly preferred
4106     * when finding the intersection of two pieces of packed data.
4107     * @param left A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4108     * @param right A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4109     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that were "on" in both left and right
4110     */
4111    public static short[] intersectPacked(short[] left, short[] right)
4112    {
4113        if(left.length == 0 || right.length == 0)
4114            return ALL_WALL;
4115        ShortVLA packing = new ShortVLA(64);
4116        boolean on = false, onLeft = false, onRight = false;
4117        int idx = 0, skip = 0, elemLeft = 0, elemRight = 0, totalLeft = 0, totalRight = 0;
4118        while ((elemLeft < left.length && elemRight < right.length) && idx <= 0xffff) {
4119            if (elemLeft >= left.length) {
4120                totalLeft = 0x20000;
4121                onLeft = false;
4122            }
4123            else if(totalLeft <= idx) {
4124                totalLeft += left[elemLeft] & 0xffff;
4125            }
4126            if(elemRight >= right.length) {
4127                totalRight = 0x20000;
4128                onRight = false;
4129            }
4130            else if(totalRight <= idx) {
4131                totalRight += right[elemRight] & 0xffff;
4132            }
4133            // 300, 5, 6, 8, 2, 4
4134            // 290, 12, 9, 1
4135            // =
4136            // 300, 2, 9, 1
4137            // 300 off, 2 on, 9 off, 1 on
4138            if(totalLeft < totalRight)
4139            {
4140                onLeft = !onLeft;
4141                skip += totalLeft - idx;
4142                idx = totalLeft;
4143                if(on != (onLeft && onRight)) {
4144                    packing.add((short) skip);
4145                    skip = 0;
4146                    on = !on;
4147                }
4148                elemLeft++;
4149            }
4150            else if(totalLeft == totalRight)
4151            {
4152                onLeft = !onLeft;
4153                onRight = !onRight;
4154                skip += totalLeft - idx;
4155                idx = totalLeft;
4156                if(on != (onLeft && onRight)) {
4157                    packing.add((short) skip);
4158                    skip = 0;
4159                    on = !on;
4160                }
4161                elemLeft++;
4162                elemRight++;
4163
4164            }
4165            else
4166            {
4167                onRight = !onRight;
4168                skip += totalRight - idx;
4169                idx = totalRight;
4170                if(on != (onLeft && onRight)) {
4171                    packing.add((short) skip);
4172                    skip = 0;
4173                    on = !on;
4174                }
4175                elemRight++;
4176            }
4177        }
4178        return packing.toArray();
4179    }
4180
4181    /**
4182     * Checks if no cells are encoded as "on" in packed.
4183     * @param packed a packed array such as one produced by pack()
4184     * @return false if there is at least one "on" cell in packed; true if there are no "on" cells
4185     */
4186    public static boolean isEmpty(short[] packed)
4187    {
4188        return packed == null || packed.length <= 1;
4189    }
4190    /**
4191     * Given two packed short arrays, left and right, this returns true if they encode any overlapping area (their areas
4192     * intersect), or false if they do not overlap at all (they don't intersect). This is more efficient than calculating
4193     * the intersection with intersectPacked() just to check if it is non-empty, since this method can short-circuit and
4194     * return true the moment it finds an intersection, plus it needs less overhead (slightly) to do so.
4195     * @param left A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4196     * @param right A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4197     * @return The boolean true if left and right overlap at all, or false if they lack any intersecting area
4198     */
4199    public static boolean intersects(short[] left, short[] right)
4200    {
4201        if(left.length == 0 || right.length == 0)
4202            return false;
4203        boolean onLeft = false, onRight = false;
4204        int idx = 0, elemLeft = 0, elemRight = 0, totalLeft = 0, totalRight = 0;
4205        while ((elemLeft < left.length && elemRight < right.length) && idx <= 0xffff) {
4206            if (elemLeft >= left.length) {
4207                totalLeft = 0x20000;
4208                onLeft = false;
4209            }
4210            else if(totalLeft <= idx) {
4211                totalLeft += left[elemLeft] & 0xffff;
4212            }
4213            if(elemRight >= right.length) {
4214                totalRight = 0x20000;
4215                onRight = false;
4216            }
4217            else if(totalRight <= idx) {
4218                totalRight += right[elemRight] & 0xffff;
4219            }
4220            // 300, 5, 6, 8, 2, 4
4221            // 290, 12, 9, 1
4222            // =
4223            // 300, 2, 9, 1
4224            // 300 off, 2 on, 9 off, 1 on
4225            if(totalLeft < totalRight)
4226            {
4227                onLeft = !onLeft;
4228                idx = totalLeft;
4229                if(onLeft && onRight) return true;
4230                elemLeft++;
4231            }
4232            else if(totalLeft == totalRight)
4233            {
4234                onLeft = !onLeft;
4235                onRight = !onRight;
4236                idx = totalLeft;
4237                if(onLeft && onRight) return true;
4238                elemLeft++;
4239                elemRight++;
4240
4241            }
4242            else
4243            {
4244                onRight = !onRight;
4245                idx = totalRight;
4246                if(onLeft && onRight) return true;
4247                elemRight++;
4248            }
4249        }
4250        return false;
4251    }
4252
4253    /**
4254     * Given one packed short array, this produces a packed short array that is the exact opposite of the one passed in,
4255     * that is, every "on" cell becomes "off" and every "off" cell becomes "on", including cells that were "off" because
4256     * they were beyond the boundaries of the original 2D array passed to pack() or a similar method. This method does
4257     * not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive), and actually requires among the lowest
4258     * amounts of computation to get a result of any methods in CoordPacker. However, because it will cause cells to be
4259     * considered "on" that would cause an exception if directly converted to x,y positions and accessed in the source
4260     * 2D array, this method should primarily be used in conjunction with operations such as intersectPacked(), or have
4261     * the checking for boundaries handled internally by unpack() or related methods such as unpackMultiDouble().
4262     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4263     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" all cells that were "off" in original
4264     */
4265    public static short[] negatePacked(short[] original) {
4266        if (original.length <= 1) {
4267            return ALL_ON;
4268        }
4269        if (original[0] == 0) {
4270            short[] copy = new short[original.length - 2];
4271            System.arraycopy(original, 1, copy, 0, original.length - 2);
4272            //copy[original.length - 3] = (short) (0xFFFF - covered(copy));
4273            return copy;
4274        }
4275        short[] copy = new short[original.length + 2];
4276        copy[0] = 0;
4277        System.arraycopy(original, 0, copy, 1, original.length);
4278        copy[copy.length - 1] = (short) (0xFFFF - covered(copy));
4279        return copy;
4280    }
4281
4282    /**
4283     * Given two packed short arrays, left and right, this produces a packed short array that encodes "on" for any cell
4284     * that was "on" in left but "off" in right, and encodes "off" for cells that were "on" in right or "off" in left.
4285     * This method does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly
4286     * preferred when finding a region of one packed array that is not contained in another packed array.
4287     * @param left A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4288     * @param right A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4289     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that were "on" in left and "off" in right
4290     */
4291    public static short[] differencePacked(short[] left, short[] right)
4292    {
4293        if(left.length <= 1)
4294            return ALL_WALL;
4295        if(right.length <= 1)
4296            return left;
4297        ShortVLA packing = new ShortVLA(64);
4298        boolean on = false, onLeft = false, onRight = false;
4299        int idx = 0, skip = 0, elemLeft = 0, elemRight = 0, totalLeft = 0, totalRight = 0;
4300        while ((elemLeft < left.length || elemRight < right.length) && idx <= 0xffff) {
4301            if (elemLeft >= left.length) {
4302                totalLeft = 0x20000;
4303                onLeft = false;
4304            }
4305            else if(totalLeft <= idx) {
4306                totalLeft += left[elemLeft] & 0xffff;
4307            }
4308            if(elemRight >= right.length) {
4309                totalRight = 0x20000;
4310                onRight = false;
4311            }
4312            else if(totalRight <= idx) {
4313                totalRight += right[elemRight] & 0xffff;
4314            }
4315            if(totalLeft < totalRight)
4316            {
4317                onLeft = !onLeft;
4318                skip += totalLeft - idx;
4319                idx = totalLeft;
4320                if(on != (onLeft && !onRight)) {
4321                    packing.add((short) skip);
4322                    skip = 0;
4323                    on = !on;
4324                }
4325                elemLeft++;
4326            }
4327            else if(totalLeft == totalRight)
4328            {
4329                onLeft = !onLeft;
4330                onRight = !onRight;
4331                skip += totalLeft - idx;
4332                idx = totalLeft;
4333                if(on != (onLeft && !onRight)) {
4334                    packing.add((short) skip);
4335                    skip = 0;
4336                    on = !on;
4337                }
4338                elemLeft++;
4339                elemRight++;
4340
4341            }
4342            else
4343            {
4344                onRight = !onRight;
4345                skip += totalRight - idx;
4346                idx = totalRight;
4347                if(on != (onLeft && !onRight)) {
4348                    packing.add((short) skip);
4349                    skip = 0;
4350                    on = !on;
4351                }
4352                elemRight++;
4353            }
4354        }
4355        return packing.toArray();
4356    }
4357
4358    /**
4359     * Given two packed short arrays, left and right, this produces a packed short array that encodes "on" for any cell
4360     * that was "on" only in left or only in right, but not a cell that was "off" in both or "on" in both. This method
4361     * does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly preferred
4362     * when performing an exclusive-or operation on two pieces of packed data.
4363     * <br>
4364     * Could more-correctly be called exclusiveDisjunctionPacked to match the other terms, but... seriously?
4365     * @param left A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4366     * @param right A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4367     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells such that left's cell ^ right's cell returns true
4368     */
4369    public static short[] xorPacked(short[] left, short[] right)
4370    {
4371        if(left.length == 0)
4372            return right;
4373        if(right.length == 0)
4374            return left;
4375        ShortVLA packing = new ShortVLA(64);
4376        boolean on = false, onLeft = false, onRight = false;
4377        int idx = 0, skip = 0, elemLeft = 0, elemRight = 0, totalLeft = 0, totalRight = 0;
4378        while ((elemLeft < left.length || elemRight < right.length) && idx <= 0xffff) {
4379            if (elemLeft >= left.length) {
4380                totalLeft = 0x20000;
4381                onLeft = false;
4382            }
4383            else if(totalLeft <= idx) {
4384                totalLeft += left[elemLeft] & 0xffff;
4385            }
4386            if(elemRight >= right.length) {
4387                totalRight = 0x20000;
4388                onRight = false;
4389            }
4390            else if(totalRight <= idx) {
4391                totalRight += right[elemRight] & 0xffff;
4392            }
4393            // 300, 5, 6, 8, 2, 4
4394            // 290, 12, 9, 1
4395            // =
4396            // 290, 15, 6, 8, 2, 4
4397            // 290 off in both, 10 in right, 2 in both, 3 in left, 6 off in both, 1 on in both, 7 on in left, 2 off in
4398            //     both, 4 on in left
4399            if(totalLeft < totalRight)
4400            {
4401                onLeft = !onLeft;
4402                skip += totalLeft - idx;
4403                idx = totalLeft;
4404                if(on != (onLeft ^ onRight)) {
4405                    packing.add((short) skip);
4406                    skip = 0;
4407                    on = !on;
4408                }
4409                elemLeft++;
4410            }
4411            else if(totalLeft == totalRight)
4412            {
4413                onLeft = !onLeft;
4414                onRight = !onRight;
4415                skip += totalLeft - idx;
4416                idx = totalLeft;
4417                if(on != (onLeft ^ onRight)) {
4418                    packing.add((short) skip);
4419                    skip = 0;
4420                    on = !on;
4421                }
4422                elemLeft++;
4423                elemRight++;
4424
4425            }
4426            else
4427            {
4428                onRight = !onRight;
4429                skip += totalRight - idx;
4430                idx = totalRight;
4431                if(on != (onLeft ^ onRight)) {
4432                    packing.add((short) skip);
4433                    skip = 0;
4434                    on = !on;
4435                }
4436                elemRight++;
4437            }
4438        }
4439        return packing.toArray();
4440    }
4441
4442    /**
4443     * Returns a new packed short[] containing the Hilbert distance hilbert as "on", and all other cells "off".
4444     * Much more efficient than packSeveral called with only one argument.
4445     * @param hilbert a Hilbert distance that will be encoded as "on"
4446     * @return the point given to this encoded as "on" in a packed short array
4447     */
4448    public static short[] packOne(int hilbert)
4449    {
4450        return new short[]{(short) hilbert, 1};
4451    }
4452    /**
4453     * Returns a new packed short[] containing the Coord point as "on", and all other cells "off".
4454     * Much more efficient than packSeveral called with only one argument.
4455     * @param point a Coord that will be encoded as "on"
4456     * @return the point given to this encoded as "on" in a packed short array
4457     */
4458    public static short[] packOne(Coord point)
4459    {
4460        return new short[]{(short) coordToHilbert(point), 1};
4461    }
4462    /**
4463     * Returns a new packed short[] containing the given x,y cell as "on", and all other cells "off".
4464     * Much more efficient than packSeveral called with only one argument.
4465     * @param x the x component of the point that will be encoded as "on"
4466     * @param y the y component of the point that will be encoded as "on"
4467     * @return the point given to this encoded as "on" in a packed short array
4468     */
4469    public static short[] packOne(int x, int y)
4470    {
4471        return new short[]{(short) posToHilbert(x, y), 1};
4472    }
4473    /**
4474     * Returns a new packed short[] containing the Hilbert distances in hilbert as "on" cells, and all other cells "off"
4475     * @param hilbert a vararg or array of Hilbert distances that will be encoded as "on"
4476     * @return the points given to this encoded as "on" in a packed short array
4477     */
4478    public static short[] packSeveral(int... hilbert)
4479    {
4480        if(hilbert == null || hilbert.length == 0)
4481            return ALL_WALL;
4482        Arrays.sort(hilbert);
4483        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(128);
4484        int current, past = hilbert[0], skip = 0;
4485
4486        vla.add((short)hilbert[0]);
4487        for (int i = 1; i < hilbert.length; i++) {
4488            current = hilbert[i];
4489            if (current - past > 1)
4490            {
4491                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
4492                skip = 0;
4493                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
4494            }
4495            else if(current != past)
4496                skip++;
4497            past = current;
4498        }
4499        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
4500        return vla.toArray();
4501    }
4502
4503    /**
4504     * Returns a new packed short[] containing the Coords in points as "on" cells, and all other cells "off"
4505     * @param points a vararg or array of Coords that will be encoded as "on"
4506     * @return the points given to this encoded as "on" in a packed short array
4507     */
4508    public static short[] packSeveral(Coord... points)
4509    {
4510        if(points == null || points.length == 0)
4511            return ALL_WALL;
4512        int[] hilbert = new int[points.length];
4513        for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
4514            if(points[i] == null) return ALL_WALL;
4515            hilbert[i] = coordToHilbert(points[i]);
4516        }
4517
4518        Arrays.sort(hilbert);
4519        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(128);
4520        int current, past = hilbert[0], skip = 0;
4521
4522        vla.add((short)hilbert[0]);
4523        for (int i = 1; i < hilbert.length; i++) {
4524            current = hilbert[i];
4525            if (current - past > 1)
4526            {
4527                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
4528                skip = 0;
4529                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
4530            }
4531            else if(current != past)
4532                skip++;
4533            past = current;
4534        }
4535        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
4536        return vla.toArray();
4537    }
4538    /**
4539     * Returns a new packed short[] containing the Coords in points as "on" cells, and all other cells "off"
4540     * @param points a Collection of Coords that will be encoded as "on"
4541     * @return the points given to this encoded as "on" in a packed short array
4542     */
4543    public static short[] packSeveral(Collection<Coord> points)
4544    {
4545        if(points == null || points.isEmpty())
4546            return ALL_WALL;
4547        int sz = points.size();
4548        int[] hilbert = new int[sz];
4549        int idx = 0;
4550        for(Coord c : points)
4551        {
4552            if(c == null) return ALL_WALL;
4553            hilbert[idx++] = coordToHilbert(c);
4554        }
4555        Arrays.sort(hilbert);
4556        ShortVLA vla = new ShortVLA(128);
4557        int current, past = hilbert[0], skip = 0;
4558
4559        vla.add((short)hilbert[0]);
4560        for (int i = 1; i < hilbert.length; i++) {
4561            current = hilbert[i];
4562            if (current - past > 1)
4563            {
4564                vla.add((short) (skip+1));
4565                skip = 0;
4566                vla.add((short)(current - past - 1));
4567            }
4568            else if(current != past)
4569                skip++;
4570            past = current;
4571        }
4572        vla.add((short)(skip+1));
4573        return vla.toArray();
4574    }
4575    /**
4576     * Given one packed short array, original, and a Hilbert Curve index, hilbert, this produces a packed short array
4577     * that encodes "on" for any cell that was "on" in original, always encodes "on" for the position referred
4578     * to by hilbert, and encodes "off" for cells that were "off" in original and are not the cell hilbert refers to.
4579     * This method does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly
4580     * preferred when finding a region of one packed array that is not contained in another packed array.
4581     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4582     * @param hilbert A Hilbert Curve index that should be inserted into the result
4583     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that are "on" in original or correspond to hilbert
4584     */
4585    public static short[] insertPacked(short[] original, short hilbert)
4586    {
4587        return unionPacked(original, new short[]{hilbert, 1});
4588    }
4589    /**
4590     * Given one packed short array, original, and a position as x,y numbers, this produces a packed short array
4591     * that encodes "on" for any cell that was "on" in original, always encodes "on" for the position referred
4592     * to by x and y, and encodes "off" for cells that were "off" in original and are not the cell x and y refer to.
4593     * This method does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly
4594     * preferred when finding a region of one packed array that is not contained in another packed array.
4595     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4596     * @param x The x position at which to insert the "on" cell
4597     * @param y The y position at which to insert the "on" cell
4598     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that are "on" in original or correspond to x,y
4599     */
4600    public static short[] insertPacked(short[] original, int x, int y)
4601    {
4602        return unionPacked(original, new short[]{(short)posToHilbert(x, y), 1});
4603    }
4604
4605    /**
4606     * Given one packed short array, original, and a number of Hilbert Curve indices, hilbert, this produces a packed
4607     * short array that encodes "on" for any cell that was "on" in original, always encodes "on" for the position
4608     * referred to by any element of hilbert, and encodes "off" for cells that were "off" in original and are not in any
4609     * cell hilbert refers to. This method does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive)
4610     * and so should be strongly preferred when you have several Hilbert Curve indices, possibly nearby each other but
4611     * just as possibly not, that you need inserted into a packed array.
4612     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4613     * @param hilbert an array or vararg of Hilbert Curve indices that should be inserted into the result
4614     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that are "on" in original or are contained in hilbert
4615     */
4616    public static short[] insertSeveralPacked(short[] original, int... hilbert)
4617    {
4618        return unionPacked(original, packSeveral(hilbert));
4619    }
4620    /**
4621     * Given one packed short array, original, and a number of Coords, points, this produces a packed
4622     * short array that encodes "on" for any cell that was "on" in original, always encodes "on" for the position
4623     * referred to by any element of points, and encodes "off" for cells that were "off" in original and are not in any
4624     * cell points refers to. This method does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive)
4625     * and so should be strongly preferred when you have several Coords, possibly nearby each other but
4626     * just as possibly not, that you need inserted into a packed array.
4627     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4628     * @param points an array or vararg of Coords that should be inserted into the result
4629     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that are "on" in original or are contained in hilbert
4630     */
4631    public static short[] insertSeveralPacked(short[] original, Coord... points)
4632    {
4633        return unionPacked(original, packSeveral(points));
4634    }
4635    /**
4636     * Given one packed short array, original, and a Collection of Coords, points, this produces a packed
4637     * short array that encodes "on" for any cell that was "on" in original, always encodes "on" for the position
4638     * referred to by any element of points, and encodes "off" for cells that were "off" in original and are not in any
4639     * cell points refers to. This method does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive)
4640     * and so should be strongly preferred when you have several Coords, possibly nearby each other but
4641     * just as possibly not, that you need inserted into a packed array.
4642     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4643     * @param points an array or vararg of Coords that should be inserted into the result
4644     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that are "on" in original or are contained in hilbert
4645     */
4646    public static short[] insertSeveralPacked(short[] original, Collection<Coord> points)
4647    {
4648        return unionPacked(original, packSeveral(points));
4649    }
4650    /**
4651     * Given one packed short array, original, and a Hilbert Curve index, hilbert, this produces a packed short array
4652     * that encodes "on" for any cell that was "on" in original, unless it was the position referred to by hilbert, and
4653     * encodes "off" for cells that were "off" in original or are the cell hilbert refers to.
4654     * This method does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly
4655     * preferred when finding a region of one packed array that is not contained in another packed array.
4656     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4657     * @param hilbert A Hilbert Curve index that should be removed from the result
4658     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that are "on" in original and don't correspond to hilbert
4659     */
4660    public static short[] removePacked(short[] original, short hilbert)
4661    {
4662        return differencePacked(original, new short[]{hilbert, 1});
4663    }
4664    /**
4665     * Given one packed short array, original, and a position as x,y numbers, this produces a packed short array that
4666     * encodes "on" for any cell that was "on" in original, unless it was the position referred to by x and y, and
4667     * encodes "off" for cells that were "off" in original or are the cell x and y refer to.
4668     * This method does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly
4669     * preferred when finding a region of one packed array that is not contained in another packed array.
4670     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4671     * @param x The x position at which to remove any "on" cell
4672     * @param y The y position at which to remove any "on" cell
4673     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that are "on" in original and don't correspond to x,y
4674     */
4675    public static short[] removePacked(short[] original, int x, int y)
4676    {
4677        int dist = posToHilbert(x, y);
4678        return differencePacked(original, new short[]{(short)dist, 1});
4679    }
4680
4681    /**
4682     * Given one packed short array, original, and a number of Hilbert Curve indices, hilbert, this produces a packed
4683     * short array that encodes "on" for any cell that was "on" in original, unless it was a position referred to by
4684     * hilbert, and encodes "off" for cells that were "off" in original and are a cell hilbert refers to. This method
4685     * does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly preferred
4686     * when you have several Hilbert Curve indices, possibly nearby each other but just as possibly not, that you need
4687     * removed from a packed array.
4688     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4689     * @param hilbert an array or vararg of Hilbert Curve indices that should be inserted into the result
4690     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that are "on" in original and aren't contained in hilbert
4691     */
4692    public static short[] removeSeveralPacked(short[] original, int... hilbert)
4693    {
4694        return differencePacked(original, packSeveral(hilbert));
4695    }
4696
4697    /**
4698     * Given one packed short array, original, and a number of Coords, points, this produces a packed short
4699     * array that encodes "on" for any cell that was "on" in original, unless it was a position referred to by an element
4700     * in points, and encodes "off" for cells that were "off" in original and are a cell points refers to. This method
4701     * does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly preferred
4702     * when you have several Hilbert Curve indices, possibly nearby each other but just as possibly not, that you need
4703     * removed from a packed array.
4704     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4705     * @param points an array or vararg of Coords that should be removed from the result
4706     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that are "on" in original and aren't contained in points
4707     */
4708    public static short[] removeSeveralPacked(short[] original, Coord... points)
4709    {
4710        return differencePacked(original, packSeveral(points));
4711    }
4712
4713    /**
4714     * Given one packed short array, original, and a number of Coords, points, this produces a packed short
4715     * array that encodes "on" for any cell that was "on" in original, unless it was a position referred to by an element
4716     * in points, and encodes "off" for cells that were "off" in original and are a cell points refers to. This method
4717     * does not do any unpacking (which can be somewhat computationally expensive) and so should be strongly preferred
4718     * when you have several Hilbert Curve indices, possibly nearby each other but just as possibly not, that you need
4719     * removed from a packed array.
4720     * @param original A packed array such as one produced by pack()
4721     * @param points a Collection of Coords that should be removed from the result
4722     * @return A packed array that encodes "on" for all cells that are "on" in original and aren't contained in points
4723     */
4724    public static short[] removeSeveralPacked(short[] original, Collection<Coord> points)
4725    {
4726        return differencePacked(original, packSeveral(points));
4727    }
4728
4729    /**
4730     * Given a packed data array that encodes multiple unconnected "on" areas, this finds each isolated area (areas that
4731     * are only adjacent diagonally are considered separate from each other) and returns it as an element in an
4732     * ArrayList of short[], with one short[] array per isolated area. Useful when you have, for example, all the rooms
4733     * in a dungeon with their connecting corridors removed, but want to separate the rooms. You can get the
4734     * aforementioned data assuming a bare dungeon called map with WIDTH and HEIGHT constants using:
4735     * <br>
4736     * {@code short[] floors = pack(map, '.'),
4737     * rooms = flood(floors, retract(floors, 1, WIDTH, HEIGHT, true), 2, false),
4738     * corridors = differencePacked(floors, rooms),
4739     * doors = intersectPacked(rooms, fringe(corridors, 1, WIDTH, HEIGHT, false));}
4740     * <br>
4741     * You can then get all rooms as separate regions with {@code List<short[]> apart = split(rooms);}, or substitute
4742     * {@code split(corridors)} to get the corridors. The room-finding technique works by shrinking floors by a radius
4743     * of 1 (8-way), which causes thin areas like corridors of 2 or less width to be removed, then flood-filling the
4744     * floors out from the area that produces by 2 cells (4-way this time) to restore the original size of non-corridor
4745     * areas (plus some extra to ensure odd shapes are kept). Corridors are obtained by removing the rooms from floors.
4746     * The example code also gets the doors (which overlap with rooms, not corridors) by finding where the a room and a
4747     * corridor are adjacent. This technique is used with some enhancements in the RoomFinder class.
4748     * @see squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.RoomFinder for a class that uses this technique without exposing CoordPacker
4749     * @param packed a packed data array that probably encodes multiple unconnected "on" areas
4750     * @return an ArrayList of short[] containing each unconnected area from packed as a short[] element
4751     */
4752    public static ArrayList<short[]> split(short[] packed)
4753    {
4754        ArrayList<short[]> arrays = new ArrayList<>(32);
4755        short[] remaining = new short[packed.length];
4756        System.arraycopy(packed, 0, remaining, 0, packed.length);
4757        while (remaining.length > 1) {
4758            boolean on = false;
4759            int idx = 0;
